title: smile_precure!
body:
The ninth installment of the [[precure|Pretty Cure]] franchise. It aired on February 5, 2012, and features five Precures alongside one mascot. The main theme is fairy tales. 

In 2015, an English adaptation of the series titled [b]Glitter Force[/b] was released as a Netflix exclusive.

title: four-finger_heart_hands
body:
[[Heart hands]] made with only four fingers.

The heart is usually made with the thumb and index fingers or the index and middle fingers.

The remaining six fingers are most often fully stretched or clenched, but there are also cases where they are slightly bent. In this case, we need to consider whether the fingers are naturally bent due to our anatomy, or whether the rest of the fingers are also bent in a heart shape and are in the process of forming the original heart hand.

h4. Examples

* !post #5417445
* !post #8214300

h4. See also

* [[Finger heart]]

title: winter_uniform
body:
A [[school uniform]] worn during [[winter]] or [[cold]]er months. Notable examples are [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[black serafuku]] or [[blazer]]s worn over [[cardigan]]s.

Not to be used for military uniforms for cold climates (e.g. those with arctic camouflage).

h4.See also

* [[summer uniform]]
* [[multiple seasonal school uniforms]]
* [[List of Uniforms]]

title: summer_uniform
body:
A [[school uniform]] worn during [[summer]] or [[hot]]ter months. Notable examples are [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]]s or [[white serafuku]]. May still include a [[cardigan vest]] or [[sweater vest]].

Not to be used for military uniforms for warmer climates (e.g. desert camouflage fatigues).

title: country_lolita
body:
A more toned-down, pastoral style of [[Lolita fashion]].

It typically uses a lot of [[gingham]] patterns, [[apple]] and other [[fruit]] motifs, [[floral print]]s, [[basket]]s, [[hat]]s, and classic colors such as reds and greens. 

h4. Examples

* !post #9063101
* !post #7776469

h4. See also
 
* [[Classic Lolita]]
* [[Mori Kei]]
* [[Tag Group:Fashion style]]

title: hime_lolita
body:
A substyle of [[Lolita fashion]] derived from [[Hime Gyaru]], featuring an over-the-top princessy aesthetic, often overlapping with either [[Classic Lolita]] or [[Sweet Lolita]].

Typically lighter colors are used and pieces have a significant amount of [[frills]]. [[Big hair]]styles with [[ringlets]] and curls are common, similar to Hime Gyaru. [[Crown]]s and [[tiara]]s make for common accessories, along with [[elbow gloves]], gold or silver [[jewelry]], [[rose]]s, and [[pearl]]s. Shoes are usually [[high heels]], but [[mary janes]] are worn as well.

h4. Examples

* !post #9065442
* !post #6978369

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Fashion style]]

title: merman
body:
A mythical sea creature which has the top half of a human male and the hind half (fins) of a fish. Less commonly known and often depicted less attractive than their female counterparts, though they've been looking more human and just as pretty as their female counterparts as time goes on.

Not to be confused with [[fish boy|fishmen]], which have a humanoid hind half but more fishlike characteristics throughout their bodies.

title: maus_(tank)
body:
The [b]Panzerkampfwagen VIII Maus[/b] ("Mouse") was a German [[World War II]] super-heavy [[tank]] prototype design completed in late 1944.

It is the heaviest fully enclosed armored fighting vehicle ever built. The complete vehicle was 10.2 metres (33 ft 6 in) long, 3.71 metres (12 ft 2 in) wide and 3.63 metres (11.9 ft) high. Weighing 188 metric tons, the Maus's main armament was the Krupp-designed 128 mm KwK 44 L/55 gun, based on the 12.8 cm Pak 44 anti-tank field artillery piece also used in the casemate-type [[Jagdtiger]] tank destroyer, with a coaxial 75 mm KwK 44 L/36.5 gun. The 128 mm gun was powerful enough to destroy all Allied armored fighting vehicles then in service, some at ranges exceeding 3,500 metres (3,800 yd).

However, the vehicle's extreme weight meant that it was ridiculously slow and impractical, being a perfect target for bombing runs by aircraft. In addition, it was a logistical nightmare, needing absurd amounts of fuel and being difficult to maintain and repair. If fielded in large numbers, it would most likely not have had any significant effect on the war effort due to its complete unsuitability for the mobile, air-dominated battlefield. Only two prototypes were constructed, the first of which did not have an actual turret. The second prototype had its hull destroyed by the Germans to prevent Russian forces from capturing it. The surviving Maus in Kublinka tank museum today is the turret from the second prototype on the hull of the first prototype.

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Panzerkampfwagen VIII Maus":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panzer_VIII_Maus

title: aureole_(panzer_front)
body:
Schnell Jagdpanzer SchkII AUREOLE is a fictional German high-speed tank destroyer in [[Panzer Front]], designed by [[Satou Michiaki]].
This [[turretless tank]] is characterized by its low height and gas turbine engine.

title: karl_i/iv/iii
body:
Karl von Habsburg (August 17, 1887 - April 1, 1922) was the second and final emperor of [[Austria-Hungary]]. In addition to his Imperial title as "Charles I of [[Austria]]", he had the Royal titles of "Charles IV of [[Hungary]]" and "Charles III of [[Czech Republic|Bohemia]]".

title: pinky_out
body:
"When in doubt, pinky out."

A habit of etiquette when drinking from a teacup, where the 'pinky' finger is extended while the others are retracted. May be applied to other situations. Also known as "pinky up".

[[Iseri Nina]] is known for extending her pinky as a substitute of a [[middle finger]].

h4. See also

* [[pinky swear]]

title: big_sister_(bioshock)
body: In [[BioShock 2]], the Big Sisters are post-pubescent [[Little Sister (bioshock)|]]s that have become unstable in Rapture's environment. Ten years after the events of [[bioshock (series)|BioShock]], they are charged with maintaining the ecological balance in Rapture. The Big Sisters' designs are geared towards accommodating Little Sisters; they have a cage-like basket that is adorned with ribbons, which is used to safely carry Little Sisters on their backs, and childish doodles can be seen on their oxygen tanks.

title: severa_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Severa[/b] is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Awakening]]. 

She is the future daughter of [[cordelia (fire emblem)|Cordelia]]. Stuck under her mother's shadow for most of her life, she desired to become her own person unattached to her mother's legacy. Abrasive to a fault, but somewhat softens up. Has highly [[tsundere]] tendencies.

Voiced by Seto Saori in the Japanese version and [[Julie Ann Taylor]] in the English version (who also voices her mother Cordelia in that version.)

h4. Appearance

* !post #6952044
* !post #4419085: [[severa (spring) (fire emblem)|Spring]]

h4. See also

* [[Selena (Fire Emblem Fates)|]] - her appearance in [[Fire Emblem Fates]]
other_names: セレナ(ファイアーエムブレム)

title: selena_(fire_emblem_fates)
body:
[b]Selena[/b] (ルーナ, [i]Luna[/i] in the Japanese version) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

[[Camilla (fire emblem)|]]'s subordinate. A sore loser. Even if she's not the best at everything, in her mind she is, and has made great efforts to live up to her potential. She lets her guard down and is surprisingly kind to her female friends.

She is an alternate version of [spoiler][[Severa (Fire Emblem)|]] crossed over from a different dimension, along with [[Laslow (Fire Emblem)|]] and [[Odin (Fire Emblem)|]].[/spoiler]

She is voiced by Seto Saori in the Japanese version and [[Julie Ann Taylor]] in the English version.

Not to be confused with the [[Selena (Fire Emblem: The Sacred Stones)|character of the same name]] from [[Fire Emblem: The Sacred Stones]].

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Mercenary

h4. Appearance

title: mochtroid
body:
Failed clones of [[Metroid (creature)|]]s, significantly weaker and barely able to latch on to their prey. They are first seen in [[Super Metroid]], as holograms in the demo release of [[Metroid Prime Hunters]], and in [[Metroid Prime 4: Beyond]].

Physically they share almost every trait a standard Metroid does, but have only one nucleus instead of the usual four.

title: metroid_larva
body:
A [[metroid (creature)|]] in its infancy. This is the most common form ever seen, as they require highly specific environmental conditions to evolve properly.

Larvae are shaped like green jellyfish with four red nuclei inside their dome, and two sets of fangs to grip its prey with on their underbelly. They float through the air with ease, and can carry and push things roughly their size or slightly larger. By latching onto prey and draining the life force from it, the prey disintegrates into dust if the lifeless husk is disturbed after feeding.

Not to be confused with [[mochtroid]]s, which are failed clones of metroids- visually distinguishable by only one nucleus.

h4. Appearance
* !asset #25600120

h4. See also

title: evertsen_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the destroyer HNLMS [i]Evertsen[/i], the second Dutch shipgirl in the game. 

She is portrayed with [[very long hair|very long]] [[grey hair]] tied into [[twin braids]], [[purple eyes]], [[large breasts]], and is [[barefoot]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[white dress]] top, [[covered navel]], [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[black skirt]], [[green coat]] worn [[off shoulder]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[elbow gloves]], and a [[thigh strap]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two floating hull pieces, one with a 120 mm single gun mount and another with 533 mm triple [[torpedo tubes]], plus a [[book]].

title: de_zeven_provincien_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Dutch light cruiser HNLMS [i]De Zeven Provinciën[/i] (C802), the first Royal Netherlands Navy shipgirl in the game. 

She is portrayed as an [[elf]] with [[very long hair|very long]] [[green hair]] tied into [[twintails]] and [[hair over one eye|covering her right eye]], [[green eyes]], [[large breasts]], and is [[barefoot]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[white dress]] with a [[center opening|navel cutout]], [[green coat]] worn [[off shoulder]], [[green thighhighs|green]] [[single thighhigh]] on her left leg, and a [[butterfly hair ornament]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two separate hull pieces with two 152 mm triple gun mounts per side, and a [[halo]] above her.

title: hakuryuu_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the aircraft carrier [i]Hakuryuu[/i], as part of a collaboration with [[World of Warships]]. 
Character design by [[Izuru (timbermetal)|]], voiced by [[Satou Satomi]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]], [[grey eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[mismatched horns]] with her left pointed up and right pointed to the side. Her default outfit consists of a [[black dress|black]] [[pleated dress]] with a [[side slit]], [[black jacket]], [[black gloves]], [[thigh strap]]s, and [[knee pads]]. Her [[rigging]] is a split [[flight deck]] in an animalistic style containing her 100 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP mounts]] while she uses an [[huge weapon|oversized]] [[ootachi]] as her melee weapon.

In Azur Lane, she initially behaves in a stereotypical [[sukeban]] manner, often wielding her sword and trying to strike intimidating poses. However, she's actually an air-headed girl who only wants to look cool and is easily flustered, especially if she's without her katana. 

h4. Skins

body:
The school uniform of the Ohanamitsu high school in [[Kimi no Koto ga Dai Dai Dai Dai Daisuki na 100-nin no Kanojo]].
The school allows a fairly high amount of customisation, but generally the uniform includes a dark purple blazer over a white shirt, a red necktie or ribbon, and dark purple trousers or skirt.

title: madeon_(copyright)
body:
Hugo Pierre Leclercq, better known by his stage name [[Madeon]], is a French DJ, singer, songwriter, and producer currently located in Los Angeles, CA.

His 2015 album [[Adventure_(madeon)|]] and 2019 album Good Faith are very notable within the EDM scene, the latter of the two having been nominated for a Grammy.

He is also very well known for his single [[Shelter_(song)|]].

title: shelter_(song)
body:
[i]Shelter[/i] is an animated music video created by musicians [[Porter Robinson_(copyright)|]] and [[Madeon_(copyright)|]], in collaboration with [[A-1 Pictures]] and [[Crunchyroll]]. 

Shelter tells the story of Rin, a 17-year-old girl who lives her life inside of a futuristic simulation completely by herself in infinite, beautiful loneliness. Each day, Rin awakens in virtual reality and uses a tablet which controls the simulation to create a new, different, beautiful world for herself. Until one day, everything changes, and Rin comes to learn the true origins behind her life inside a simulation.

h4. External links

* "Youtube: Music video":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fzQ6gRAEoy0

title: birdmen_(manga)
body: [b]Birdmen[/b] (stylized in all caps) is a Japanese manga series written and illustrated by Yellow Tanabe. It was serialized in Shogakukan's Weekly Shounen Sunday from July 2013 to February 2020.

title: space_ishtar_(third_ascension)_(fate)
body:
[[Space Ishtar (fate)|]]'s third ascension from [[Fate/Grand Order]], known as [b]Ishtar Astarte[/b]. Her hair changes color to purple with a blue underside, she has an upside-down crescent on her forehead, and her eyes become yellow with mismatched shapes in her pupils (a circle in her right eye, and a star in her left). She wears a red and orange bodysuit beneath a heavy red cloak with snake-like ropes coiling through it.

In the [[Saber Wars II]] event, this Ascension was the fusion between Space Ishtar's first and second ascensions in order to fight against Astarte Origin. She's in a sense, a newborn galaxy, and was able to win against Astarte Origin due to Astarte Origin being stuck in the past while Ishtar Ashtart was able to look into the future.

[[Space Ishtar (Astarte Origin) (fate)|]] is a recolor of this Ascension.

h4. Appearance
* !post #9206411
* !asset #25639830: No cloak

h4. Costumes

* "Fate/Grand Order Wiki":https://fategrandorder.fandom.com/wiki/Space_Ishtar

title: italia_(kancolle)
body:
The upgraded form of [[Littorio (kancolle)|]] in [[Kantai Collection]].  Her name simply means "Italy".

Virtually identical in appearance, the only differences outside of stats is that her [[machinery|combat gear]] no longer has the white-and-red stripes, and she has additional secondary [[ship turret|turret]]s.  

Her summer seasonal CG is almost identical to her unremodelled portrait. She simply ditches the pareo for a towel and her mouth is open.

Her Christmas seasonal CG is also almost identical to her unremodelled portrait. She simply gave her scarf to the Roma snowman.

Historically, [i]Italia[/i] was the rename of [i]Littorio[/i] after [[Benito Mussolini]] fell from power, and [i]Littorio[/i] was captured by the Allies, as the original name had Fascist connotations.

title: colorado_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the US Navy battleship USS [i]Colorado[/i] (BB-45). 
Character design by [[Parsley-F]].

h4. Appearance

Like [[iowa (kancolle)|Iowa]] before her, she is given traits, based upon some old WWII-era US Navy pin-ups such as: [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with [[side braids]], [[blue eyes]], and a [[large breasts|well endowed]] yet petite body. She wears a [[grey hat|grey]] [[garrison cap]], yardarm [[headgear]] that is already typical for the Big 7, a two-part [[grey dress|gray]] [[pleated dress]] with blue accents and a [[sleeveless]] [[white shirt]] that [[sideboob|exposes one side of each breast]], a [[blue necktie]] with the number 45 on it, [[black gloves|black]] and grey [[elbow gloves]], [[black pantyhose]], a grey [[capelet]] with blue underside, and red [[high heels|high-heeled shoes]].

Her machinery includes her famed 16-inch guns (four at each side in twin [[ship turret|turrets]]), a [[smokestack]] and a [[lattice mast]] with a large clock face among others. She is given a remodel which trades the clock face for a radar antenna atop the mast, paints her wooden deck grey and modernizes her secondary and anti-aircraft guns.

h4. History

The historical USS [i]Colorado[/i] saw a long and active career that took her into both Atlantic and Pacific oceans. She participated in a number of fleet exercises in the inter-war years, and also briefly served in various tasks such as becoming a training ship, and even assisting in the search for Amelia Earhart. During WWII, [i]Colorado[/i] saw extensive action throughout the Pacific against the Japanese, being a constant presence in pre-invasion shelling and fire support actions from Tarawa all the way to Okinawa. For her service, the battleship was awarded seven battle stars. After the war, she participated in "Operation Magic Carpet" to bring US troops back home. She was decommissioned in 1947 and sold for scrap in 1959.

h4. Trivia

She is named after the state of Colorado, the second such ship in the US Navy but the third to carry the name (the first USS [i]Colorado[/i], a steam screw frigate, was named after the Colorado River).

She is the first foreign shipgirl as well as the first personified battleship for her artist [[Parsley-f]]. She is also the fourth (second foreign) member of the so-called Big 7 (the seven battleships with 16-inch guns built before WWII) in the game, joining [[nagato (kancolle)|Nagato]], [[mutsu (kancolle)|Mutsu]], and [[nelson (kancolle)|Nelson]].

In comparison to the other Big 7 in the game, she is given a petite body and a more youthful appearance, reflecting the fact the Colorado-class battleships were the shortest of the Big 7 at 624 feet 3 inches (190.27 m) each, compared to the Nagato-class at 708 feet (215.8 m; later lengthened to 738 feet/224.94 m) each and the Nelson-class at 710 feet (216.4 m) each. In spite of this shorter length, their displacement was equal to that of her counterparts, at 32,600 long tons unloaded (compare the Nagato-class at 32,200 long tons and the Nelson-class at 33,300 long tons), which is reflected by her curvaceous figure and ample bosom.

h4. [i]Colorado[/i]-class battleships
* [b]Colorado[/b] (BB-45)
* [[Maryland (Kancolle)]] (BB-46)

h4. See also
* [[Colorado (Azur Lane)]]
* [[Colorado (Warship Girls R)]]

h4. External links

* "Kancolle Wikia: Colorado":[https://kancolle.fandom.com/Colorado]
* "Kancolle Wiki: Colorado":[http://en.kancollewiki.net/Colorado]
* "Wikipedia: USS [i]Colorado[/i] (BB-45)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Colorado_(BB-45)]
other_names: コロラド(艦隊これくしょん)

title: verniy_(kancolle)
body:
The post-WWII/Soviet/Kai2 form of [[Hibiki (kancolle)|]] in [[Kantai Collection]]. Character design by [[Yadokari (Migihashi)|]], voiced by [[Suzaki Aya]].

She replaces the sailor shirt shared with the rest of the Akatsuki class with a [[belt|belted]] button-up sailor shirt and her hat is now white with red trimmings, with a [[hammer and sickle]] and [[star (symbol)|]] pin on it. As for her [[torpedo tubes]], she replaces her Japanese 61 cm triple mounts with Soviet 53.3 cm quad mounts on either side. Curiously, she retains her 12.7 twin gun mount Type B to her right. 

h4. Trivia

Often nicknamed "Bep" (as if the cyrillic letters "Вер" were read as Latin letters), "Beppu" ("別府", same thing but as a pun to the city of the same name) or "Nuinui" ("ヌイヌイ", like [[Shiranui (kancolle)|]], so it's not uncommon to see the two being paired together) as her name might be difficult to pronounce for the Japanese (and most non-Russian speakers alike).

In-game, she is characterized with a lack of stock equipment (she predates [[Gangut (kancolle)|]]'s appearance by 3.5 years and [[Tashkent (kancolle)|]]'s - who actually used some of the equipment that Verniy would be equipped with - by 4.5 years, and thus such equipment were unavailable in-game when Verniy came out), a relatively low luck for her sheer longevity (she was only lucky in the way she avoided combat by being in repairs), and her high resilience compared to destroyers of her size (only Suzutsuki and Tashkent exceeds her in health, both are also significantly larger than Verniy, only Shimakaze, Yukikaze and Amatsukaze exceeds her armor but none of them can equip bulges, which Verniy can).

h4. Appearance

* !post #1566678: Default
* !post #2872435: [[Verniy (Saury Festival) (kancolle)|Saury Festival]]

h4. Special Type destroyers with kai ni
h5. [b]Akatsuki-class[/b]
* [[Akatsuki Kai Ni (Kancolle)|]]
* [b]Verniy[/b]

title: yamashiro_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body: For her second remodel, Yamashiro gains the changes added to Fusou's own remodel ([[floral print|floral pattern]], [[headband]], modified hair ornament and triple guns) as well as somewhat longer hair, tied low. The main difference to Fusou's remodel is that the floral pattern is to the right side instead of the left side for Fusou.

title: fusou_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body: For her second remodel, Fusou gains a [[floral print|floral pattern]] on select parts of her shirt and sleeves. Her skirt's golden floral pattern and metallic [[epaulettes]] (which were present on her original art but were pratically inexistant in fanart) have been heavily emphasized as well. Her pagoda mast hair ornament is even more ornate, a white [[headband]] is added and her hair is tied low. She also gains two heavy triple guns where two (unremodelled) or one (first remodel) heavy twin guns were previously, bumping her firepower (which was gimped in her first remodel) higher than her unremodelled form's.

title: original_remodel_(kantai_collection)
body:
Term applied to a fan artist's own rendition of what a particular [[Kantai Collection]] character's second remodel would look like, either in clothes, gear, or both. This tag applies to a shipgirl whose second remodel has yet to be implemented at the time of drawing, especially if that shipgirl would eventually get an official second remodel that is significantly different than what the fan artist imagined.

So-called "third remodels" also count as original remodels; [[Bismarck (kancolle)|]] has an official "Drei" form, [[Kongou (kancolle)|]] has an official third "what if" remodel, [[Shigure (kancolle)|]] has also been given [[shigure kai san_(kancolle)|a third retrofit]], and no other shipgirl has a form beyond a second remodel, barring seasonal CGs, although [[Yukikaze (kancolle)|]]'s nominal second remodel can be considered an actual third remodel due to the existence of her [[tan yang (kancolle)|Tan Yang]] form. Hypothetical costumes and gear that come with a yet-to-be-implemented eventual name change or form (such as Tan Yang's, pre-official implementation) can also be considered original remodels.

The tag is especially useful if a shipgirl, such as a destroyer, is given an outfit similar to those worn by her officially remodeled sisters. This is typical for shipgirls of the same class and/or fleshed out by the same illustrator.

Even if an original remodel correctly predicts an official remodel, this tag should be used depending on when the original remodel was published in relation to the release of the official one. [[shikinami (kancolle)|Shikinami's]] is a good example; her second remodel was made known through the official Kancolle calendar for 2020 (announced November 2019), but some fan artists have drawn it in some form long before that, probably using [[ayanami (kancolle)|Ayanami's]] as the basis (such as post #3841559, posted on Twitter April 2, 2019). [[yura (kancolle)|Yura's]] is another example; post #2534054 guessed in late 2016 her second remodeled form which was mostly confirmed as first teased on Comptiq's June 2017 issue (post #2719435).

h4. Examples
Compare these remodels as envisioned by [[Minosu]]...
* !post #2848628: [[Tama (kancolle)|Minosu's Tama Kai Ni]]
* !post #3000890: [[Shiranui (kancolle)|Minosu's Shiranui Kai Ni]]
* !post #2963474: [[Tenryuu (kancolle)|Minosu's Tenryuu Kai Ni]]
* !post #3169675: [[Yamato (kancolle)|Minosu's Yamato Kai Ni]]

With these official remodels
* !post #2951522: [[Tama Kai Ni (kancolle)|Official Tama Kai Ni]]
* !post #3125417:  [[Shiranui Kai Ni (kancolle)|Official Shiranui Kai Ni]]
* !post #3187762:  [[Tenryuu Kai Ni (kancolle)|Official Tenryuu Kai Ni]]
* !post #5416387:  [[Yamato Kai Ni (kancolle)|Official Yamato Kai Ni]]

title: guest_art
body:
[[Official art]] created by a guest artist. Either commissioned by a copyright holder or is [[gift art|gifted]] to the author of the work by other established artist.

This is often seen in the end matter for published manga or books (e.g. alongside the work's primary artist's afterword), or featured in [[end card]]s or [[eyecatch]]es in animated works, or in specially produced extra content, officially sanctioned [[promotional art]], and the like.

Don't use this tag for images posted in [[artist collaboration|collaborative]] works where no one artist dominates the artwork, even if one artist officially edits and publishes the work and/or solicits work from other artists.

h4. See also
* [[gift art]]
* Pool #1338 ("Popular Artists Draw Other Copyrights")

title: daybreak_(kid_icarus)
body:
A powerful cannon-like weapon from [[Kid Icarus Uprising]], appearing exclusively in multiplayer gameplay. When all three parts of the Daybreak are assembled, its wielder can fire a massive energy beam that knocks out any opponents it connects with. 
It also appears with the same use and effect in the [[Super Smash Bros.]] series, sharing this distinction with the [[Dragoon (kirby)|]].

title: dainenjiyama_aisho
body:
Aisho Dainenjiyama (大年寺山 愛唱, Dainenjiyama Aishō) is a tertiary antagonist featured in the eighth part of the [[JoJo's Bizarre Adventure]] series, [[JoJolion]].
Aisho is a baseball stadium security guard who is [spoilers] secretly a Rock Human working under the Locacaca Organization as a smuggler and dealer.  [/spoilers]He is a [[Stand (jojo)|]] user, wielding the [[Stand (jojo)|]] [[Doobie Wah!]]

Aisho is a slender man of average to below average height. His outfit is composed of a skin-tight [[black bodysuit]] with a [[cleavage cutout]], a khaki shorts with a belt, and a two-toned layered arm sleeves. He dons what appears to be a knitted wrap scarf with sleeves tied around his neck. He also wears a pair of sleeves around his head, similar to the pattern on his neck wrap scarf, with some of his hair poking out through the holes.

title: chocolate_disco
body:
Chocolate Disco (チョコレート・ディスコ, Chokorēto Disuko) is the [[Stand (jojo)|]] of [[disco_(sbr)|D-I-S-C-O]], featured in the seventh part of the [[JoJo's Bizarre Adventure]] series, [[Steel Ball Run]].

Chocolate Disco manifests itself as an [[armband]] on [[disco_(sbr)|D-I-S-C-O's]] forearm, which has the ability to divide the nearby environment into a grid and reposition anyone caught in the grid at will.
Chocolate Disco is a forearm guard resembling a vambrace. It has a grid pattern of 26 lettered rows and 10 numbered columns serving as coordinates, similarly to the board game [[Battleship]]. Each cell can be pressed.

Namesake — Chocolate Disco (Perfume song)
other_names: チョコレート・ディスコ

title: disco_(sbr)
body:
D-ID-I-S-C-O  (ディ・ス・コ, Di-su-ko) is a tertiary antagonist featured in the seventh part of the [[JoJo's Bizarre Adventure]] series, [[Steel Ball Run]].
He is a [[Stand (jojo)|]] user, wielding the gauntlet-like [[Chocolate Disco]].

D-I-S-C-O is a tall slim man, with medium-length messy, curly dark hair with a large, rectangular [[hair clip]]/accessory sitting on the left side of his head. Shaved [[beard]] and [[mustache]] can be spotted around his face.

He wears a [[long coat]] similar to the ones worn by the police officers from the 18th century; wearing his  [[Stand (jojo)|]] [[Chocolate Disco]] like an [[armband]] on his left forearm as well as wearing a handcuff for a [[belt]].

title: hey_ya_(stand)
body:
Hey Ya! (ヘイ・ヤー, Hei Yā) is the [[Stand (jojo)|]] of [[Pocoloco]], featured in the seventh part of the [[JoJo's Bizarre Adventure]] series, [[Steel Ball Run]]. Gripping [[Pocoloco]] from the back, this dwarfish [[Stand (jojo)|]] encourages and advises its user through any hardship.

Hey Ya! is a small, roughly humanoid [[Stand (jojo)|]]. Its head looks like an upturned bucket with two uneven holes for eyes. Hey Ya!'s lower jaw is pinned with bolts, and is lined with small, sharp teeth. There is also a horizontal line of bolts above its mouth.

Hey Ya! has hollow cylinders lining the top of its head with strands of rope-like hair on the ends of them. Its body is robotic with a chest and a lower torso that are connected with a chain-like spine. It also has thin arms, thin legs, and [[shoulder pads]]. On shoulders and hands, tiny bolts can be seen.

Namesake: Hey Ya! (Outkast song)

title: mighty_morphin_power_rangers:_the_movie
body:
A 1995 American [[tokusatsu]] film. The story is an alternate re-telling of the [[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers]] television series. It stars the ensemble cast of Karan Ashley, [[Johnny Yong Bosch]], Steve Cardenas, Jason David Frank, Amy Jo Johnson, and David Yost alongside the villains cast from the original series and Paul Freeman as Ivan Ooze. 

Much like the television season, it used concepts from the Japanese [[Super Sentai]] series [[Kyouryuu Sentai Zyuranger]], [[Gosei Sentai Dairanger]] and [[Ninja Sentai Kakuranger]]. It is the first [[Power Rangers]] production from Saban Entertainment not to feature any archived footage from Super Sentai, as well as the first film in the Power Rangers franchise. The designs of the third season's Ninja Rangers are based on the costumes used for the Ninjetti uniforms in this movie.

The design of the Rangers in the movie explicitly features the Power Coins of the [[Dino Buckler|Power Morpher]] on their chests to align how the [[Mighty Morphin White Ranger]]'s chest armor features one, and the suits are made of PVC and metal plating rather than the standard spandex, making them slightly bulkier.

body:
[i]Cookie Run[/i] is a series of mobile gacha games available on both iOS and Android devices, with its two most famous entries being [[Cookie Run: Ovenbreak]] in the endless running genre and [[Cookie Run: Kingdom]] in the RPG/city building genre. 

The characters are sentient [[cookie|cookies]], but are often depicted as [[humanization|humanizations]] of their in-game cookie forms. Since the Cookies are already humanoid, the [[personification]] tag should [b]not[/b] be used.

title: gokuhara_gonta
body:
[i][[Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony]][/i] character.

The Ultimate Entomologist. As a child, he had gotten lost in the woods and stayed there ever since, being raised instead by the creatures of the forest. His love of bugs comes from the time he spent with them in the woods, and he hates those who think lowly of them. Because he had been disconnected from civilization for so long until high school, he is trying to keep up and make himself a perfect gentleman.

He is a big man with [[dark-skinned male|dark skin]] and [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]]. His [[school uniform]] consists of a matching brown [[blazer]] and pants, over which he slings an [[bug cage]] over. Has [[red eyes]] and [[round eyewear|round]] [[glasses]]. Due to his forest upbringing, he tends to go [[barefoot]].

title: ipod_nano_7g
body:
The final iteration of [[iPod Nano]], released in 2012 in a wide color range, and having even more colors added in 2015. It returns to the tall rectangular shape but still omits the click wheel, leaving only a touch screen interface and a home button.

It runs on a slightly more advanced operating system that is separate from [[iOS (os)|]] despite a similar appearance.

title: ipod_nano_6g
body:
The sixth iteration of [[iPod Nano]], released in 2010. It is the most radically different model in the series, having no click wheel at all and instead only a touch screen, as well as being a small square shape similar to that of the [[iPod Shuffle 4G]].

It comes in silver, dark grey, blue, green, orange, pink, and red.

title: ipod_nano_5g
body:
The fifth iteration of [[iPod Nano]], released in 2009. It looks very similar to the [[iPod Nano 4G]] and retains all of its color variants, though slightly less saturated.

It also has a larger screen and has a metallic/glossy finish.

* !post #342239

title: ipod_nano_4g
body:
The fourth iteration of [[iPod Nano]], released in 2008 with the widest color selection yet, adding purple, orange and yellow to the previously established lineup.

It returns to the longer design, but this time it is curved. It has a more matte finish and a slightly shorter screen than the [[iPod Nano 5G]].

Additionally, the silver model's control wheel is now a dark gray.

* !post #331449

title: ipod_nano_3g
body:
The third iteration of [[iPod Nano]], released in 2007 and immediately recognizable for being much shorter than the previous two models.

It comes in silver, green, blue, black, and pink, as well as the website-exclusive red.

* !post #7889842

title: ipod_nano_2g
body:
The second iteration of the [[iPod Nano]], released in 2006. Comes in a wider range of colors, including silver, green, blue, pink, and black. An additional red color was exclusively sold on Apple's website.

It has a more rectangular shape than the previous model with sharper edges. Additionally, the wheel on the silver model is now white instead of a darker gray.

* !post #84308

title: ipod_nano_1g
body:
The first iteration of the [[iPod Nano]], released in 2005. It comes in only two colors: silver and black.

It has rounder edges than the [[iPod Nano 2G]], and the silver model's click wheel is darker rather than lighter.

* !post #10571

title: bullying
body:
The act of using the force or coercion to [[abuse]] or intimidate others. It can include verbal harassment or threat, physical or sexual assault or coercion and may be directed repeatedly towards particular victims, perhaps on grounds of race, religion, gender, sexuality, or ability.

Oftentimes, the "bully" (the person who partake in bullying) aims to prove their perceived superiority against the victim. Meanwhile, the typical target of bullying are those who were perceived to be weak or has certain odd traits, such as the stereotypical nerd. 

Some methods of bullying include forcefully [[cutting hair]], [[graffiti]], [[humiliation]], [[memorial on desk]], [[grabbing another's hair]], simply [[punching]]/[[kicking]]/[[slapping]] the target, etc.

h4. See Also

* [[abuse]]
* [[teasing]]
* [[prank]]
* [[suicide]]

title: billy_kane
body:
One of the minor villains in the [[Fatal Fury]] and [[The King of Fighters]] series. His last name is properly pronounced "Kahn".

Billy wields a [[bo staff]] that he can modularly detatch into a [[three section staff]]. He can also wreath his staff in [[fire]].

Hailing from England, Billy is [[Geese Howard]]'s right-hand man. As of [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]], following the death of Geese twelve years earlier, Billy is the new leader of his syndicate, the Howard Connection. [[Lilly Kane]] is his innocent little sister.

Billy is cited as the direct inspiration for [[Guilty Gear]]'s [[Axl Low]].

h4. See also

* [[Pretty Billy Kane]]

title: vox_reaper
body: Introduced in [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]], Vox Reaper is the successor to the late [[Grant (SNK)|Grant]]. Trained in his master's style of Dark Karate, Vox serves as the new enforcer of [[Kain R Heinlein|Kain R. Heinlein]].

title: powdered_wig
body: A type of [[wig]] worn mostly by men in the 18th century which was "powdered" to give it a bright white hue. Formal wear and often used by politicians and aristocrats.

title: fatal_fury:_city_of_the_wolves
body:
The tenth installment of the [[Fatal Fury]] series, the seventh canon entry in the series, and the second game in the series after the timeskip introduced in [[Garou: Mark of the Wolves]]. The game released April 24, 2025. City of the Wolves is the first Fatal Fury game in over 25 years, after Garou: Mark of the Wolves released in 1999. The title acknowledges both the western (Fatal Fury) and Japanese (餓狼伝説 "Garou Densetsu") names of the franchise.

The story takes place in ~2008, two years after the events of Garou:MotW - thus twelve years after the death of [[Geese Howard]], covering the events of the second running of the King of Fighters: Maximum Mayhem tournament in South Town and its prize of "Geese's legacy" as the reward.

h4. Characters

h5. Returning characters

* [[Rock Howard]]
* [[Terry Bogard]]
* [[Futaba Hotaru]]
* [[Tizoc (snk)|Tizoc/Griffon Mask]]
* [[Marco Rodrigues]]
* [[B. Jenet]]

* [[Billy Kane]]

* [[Hokutomaru]]

* [[Joe Higashi]] (Season 1 DLC)
* [[Mr Big (SNK)|Mr. Big]] (Season 1 DLC)

h5. New characters

h5. Guest characters

h5. Unplayable boss characters

* Fallen Rock
* [[Geese Howard|Nightmare Geese]]

title: rock_howard
body:
Biological son of [[Geese Howard]], adopted son of [[Terry Bogard]], Rock Howard is the protagonist of [[Garou: Mark of the Wolves]] and [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]], while also making a number of appearances in [[The King of Fighters]].

Following Geese's death after falling from his tower, Terry took a young Rock under his wing as the boy's guardian. Rock took moves from both of his fathers, learning moves from Terry and inheriting some of Geese's trademark techniques. He has business with [[Kain R Heinlein|Kain R. Heinlein]], the new big boss of South Town's underworld and the man who not only claims to be Rock's uncle, but also that the late Marie Heinlein - Rock's mother and Kain's sister - is alive. In FF:CotW, Rock finally reunites with his mother Marie and chooses to travel and find his own path, just like Terry.

In FF:CotW, an alternate unplayable boss version of Rock known as [b]Fallen Rock[/b] is manifested by the influence of the Jin scrolls, a ruthless dark reflection and personification of his "evil blood" who believes the original Rock to be a failure. Once defeated, the Jin scrolls release their hold on Rock, and he returns to normal.

Fans often pair him with [[Type-Moon]]'s [[Arima Miyako]] in [[M.U.G.E.N]] and other fan works since they are both adoptees of their respective families (Rock being the Bogards, Miyako being the Tohno).

title: grant_(snk)
body:
Sub-boss of [[Garou: Mark of the Wolves]]. His most famous feature is his red horned [[mask]].

Formerly known as Abel, Grant was the brother and chief enforcer of main boss [[Kain R Heinlein|Kain R. Heinlein]] and master of the devastating occult martial art Dark Karate. After taking a bullet to protect Kain, Grant sat at death's door for years and sought a worthy battle to end his life. Grant ultimately lost his final battle - presumably to [[Terry Bogard]] - and presumably succumbed to his wounds.

In [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]], Grant is succeeded by his disciple, [[Vox Reaper]], though Grant himself still lives.

title: nanashi_mumei_(emo)
body:
The 4th and final [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Nanashi Mumei]]. It has an [[emo fashion|emo motif]] (translated into Japanese as punk rock).

It consists of a [[black choker|black]] [[lace-trimmed choker]] with a [[heart choker|heart]] [[pendant choker|pendant]], a [[black shirt|black]] [[print shirt|print]] [[t-shirt]] featuring a variation of her infamous [[Nightmare (nanashi mumei)|"Nightmare" painting]] with a [[torn sweater|torn]] [[black sweater|black]] and [[red sweater|red]] [[striped sweater]] [[sweater under shirt|underneath]], giving her [[short over long sleeves]], an owl [[necklace]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]] [[half-skirt|half]] [[miniskirt]] with a [[black belt]], an [[o-ring thigh strap]], [[uneven legwear|uneven]] [[mismatched legwear]] (a [[single kneehigh|single]] [[black socks|black]] [[fishnet socks|fishnet kneehigh]] with a [[white leg warmers|white]] [[leg warmers|leg warmer]] on her right leg and a [[black leg warmers|black leg warmer]] on her left, both depicting her [[mascot]] [[Friend (nanashi_mumei)|]]) and [[black boots|black]] [[platform boots]].

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume, both styles are tied with [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]]s, [[long bangs|long]] [[asymmetrical bangs]], [[hair over one eye|over her right eye]] and a [[huge ahoge]]:
* [[Long hair|Long]] [[brown hair]] done in a [[one side up]]
* [[Medium hair]] done in [[twintails]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #7259920: Profile (1)
* !post #7259985: Profile (2)

title: ultraman_vs._kamen_rider
body:
A retrospective [[crossover]] special of the [[Ultra Series]] and [[Kamen Rider]], released in 1993.

This special was made to commemorate the 25th and 20th anniversaries of both franchises respectively, featuring clips from the various series from over the years, interviews with two of the stars, and finally a team-up between [[Tsuburaya Productions]]' [[Ultraman]] and Toei Company's Kamen Rider.

body:

This series was produced in between [[Ultraman Gaia (series)|]] and [[Ultraman Cosmos (series)|]]. It was aired during re-runs of [[Ultraman Tiga (series)|]] in 1999.

The series would return in 2012, with the ULTRA-EG toyline, with the toys demonstrated by the mysterious [[Dr. E.G.]], who looks suspiciously like Nice...

title: ultraman_zearth_(series)
body:
A film series in the long-running [[Ultra Series]], consisting of two movies, [i]Ultraman Zearth[/i], and [i]Ultraman Zearth 2: Superhuman War: Light and Shadow[/i]. Both movies were released in 1996 and 1997, respectively. The movies serve as a [[parody]]/spoof of the Ultra Series, in general.

It also features product placement from the [[Idemitsu (gas station)|]] petroleum company, in which the character of [[Ultraman Zearth]] is created to advertise for. Zearth would be succeeded in this role in 2007 by the Ultra Idemitsujin, who would appear exclusively in Idemitsu commercials, consisting of [[Ultraman Hotto]], [[Ultraman Motto|Motto]], and [[Ultraman Kitto|Kitto]], with their designs drawing from Zearth's. As a result, they count under Zearth's copyright tag.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ultraman_Zearth

title: ultraman_neos_(series)
body:
An installment of the long-running [[Ultra Series]]. Stars the titular [[Ultraman Neos]], with [[Ultraseven 21]] appearing as a secondary Ultraman.

It was originally going to be produced as a TV series in 1995, but it was shelved in favor of [[Ultraman Tiga (series)|]]. The project was eventually dusted off and turned into a direct-to-video series in 2000, with 12 episodes produced, in total, earning it the position of the 15th installment in the franchise. Due to the 1995 pilot, both Neos and Seven 21 are considered by Tsuburaya to be earlier Ultramen than not just [[Ultraman Tiga]], but [[Ultraman Zearth]] too.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ultraman_Neos

title: sialim_eltnam_re-atlasia
body:
A minor character in [[Fate/EXTRA]].

Sialim Eltnam Re-Atlasia is the last alchemist of the Atlas institute in the world of EXTRA. She has a twin [[Sion Eltnam (type-moon)|elder sister]] who died at birth. As an Atlasian alchemist she was devoted only to her own research, her goal is to avoid the future of destruction. Essentially, this means that it's okay for humanity to change or decline as a species if it means surviving. She created the homunculus known as [[Rani VIII]] with the intention to see if it was possible for not just alchemists but for humanity to continue existing in the cyber world, which would mean having to give up their physical bodies. After sending Rani to the moon, she succumbed to a terminal disease and passed away in a month.

h4. Appearance
* !post #2122544

h4. See also

* "Type-Moon wikia entry":http://typemoon.wikia.com/wiki/Sialim_Eltnam_Re-Atlasia#Sialim_Eltnam_Re-Atlasia

title: chen_gong_(fate)
body:
Caster-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. The former advisor of Cao Cao before defecting to become [[Lu Bu (fate)|]]'s advisor. Bears a heavy physical resemblance to [[Rani VIII]].

He cameoed in [[Fate/Extella]] before appearing as an NPC in the [[S I N (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt. He was then introduced as a playable servant in the 5th anniversary.

After his debut, he gained a memetic status thanks to his Noble Phantasm that is very similar to [[Arash (fate)|]]'s, except he sacrifices his teammates instead of himself as a demerit. Because of this, he is frequently paired with other servants that can further boost his attack, usually [[Artoria Caster (fate)|]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Wada Arco]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Madono Mitsuaki]]

title: tem_ray's_circuit
body:
A fictional electronic device from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] from 1979.

It is a technological gadget created by [[Tem Ray]] intended to enhance the abilities of any [[mobile suit]]. [spoilers]It does not work properly, as Tem was already brain damaged while developing it.[/spoilers] It is the subject of many memes in Japan, and is often featured as an optional part in the [[Super Robot Wars]] series where equipping it to a unit causes mostly detrimental effects.

title: ultra_galaxy_(series)
body:
A sub-series in the long-running [[Ultra Series]], which began in 2007. Has an eye towards fan service of some capacity, and elements from it often cross over into and linking together main installments in the franchise. The main domain of [[Ultraman Zero]], who serves as the sub-series' perennial protagonist, who would also host [i]Ultraman Retsuden[/i] and [i]Shin Ultraman Retsuden[/i] from 2011 to 2016 (and these would be followed up by [i]Ultraman Zero: The Chronicle[/i] from 2017, which recounts the main entries he had appeared in, all while still hosting, [i]Ultraman Chronicle Zero & Geed[/i] from 2020, which follows it up while being hosted by Asakura Riku, [i]Ultraman Chronicle Z: Heroes' Odyssey[/i] from 2021, and [i]Ultraman New Generation Stars[/i] from 2023 onward).

The sub-series can be subdivided into two main eras; the first era which sees the rise of the Reionics, with [[Reiblood Seijin]] and [[Ultraman Belial]] acting as its main antagonists, and the second era which sees a greater focus on multiversal stories, culminating in the emergence of the Absolutians as its main antagonists.

h4. Titles

h5. Reiblood Era

* [[Ultra Galaxy Mega Dai-Kaijuu Battle]] (2007-2009)
** [i]Dai-Kaijuu Battle Ultra Adventure[/i] (2008-2010)
* [[Dai-Kaijuu Battle Ultra Ginga Densetsu The Movie]] (2009)
* [[Ultraman Zero vs. Darklops Zero]] (2010)
* [[Ultraman Zero The Movie Choukessen! Belial Ginga Teikoku]] (2010)

h5. Multiversal Era

* [i]Killer the Beatstar[/i] (2011)
* [[Ultraman Saga (movie)|]] (2012)
* [i]Ultra Zero Fight[/i] (2012-2013)
* [[Ultra Galaxy Fight: New Generation Heroes]] (2019)
* [[Ultra Galaxy Fight: The Absolute Conspiracy]] (2020-2021)
* [[Ultra Galaxy Fight: The Destined Crossroad]] (2021-2022)
** [i]Ultraman Regulos: First Mission[/i] (2022)
** [i]Ultraman Regulos[/i] (2023)

h4. See also

* [[Ultraman Geed (series)|]] - first installment spinning off from Ultra Galaxy, with the protagonist being the son of Belial
* [[Ultraman Z (series)|]] - second installment spinning off, with the protagonist being trained by Zero

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ultra_Galaxy_Fight

title: ultraman_tiga_(series)
body:
The 12th installment of the long-running [[Ultra Series]], and the first entry in the Heisei era.

It introduces the concept of a "type-changing" Ultraman, as in the titular [[ultraman tiga|Ultra]] character changes forms/colors, depending on the battle.

[spoiler]
The show also serves as a 30th anniversary celebration of the franchise, as seen in Episode 49, aptly titled, "The Ultra Star".
[/spoiler]

In 2002, the show was dubbed in English by [[4Kids|4Kids Entertainment]], making it one of the few Ultra series dubbed in the US. The dub however, proved to be unpopular with fans, ultimately causing 4Kids to drop the show halfway through, instead opting to release an uncut, subtitled version of the series on DVD, courtesy of [[Funimation]].

h4. See also

* [[Ultraman Tiga: The Final Odyssey]]
* [[Global Unlimited Task Squad uniform]]

h4. External links

* Officially streaming on YouTube thru the TokuSHOUTsu channel (episode 1 only): "Subbed":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q2UEHi0hPSE]*
* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ultraman_Tiga
<tn>Original theme song "Take Me Higher" not included.</tn>

title: thundercats
body:
[i]Thunder...!! Thunder...!! Thunder...!!! THUNDERCATS....!!!! HOOOOOOO.....!!!!![/i] - Lion-O, Lord of the ThunderCats.

[i][b]ThunderCats[/b][/i] is an American [[science fiction]] and [[fantasy]] [[Furry]] animated television series that was produced by Rankin/Bass Productions debuting in 1985, based on the characters created by Tobin "Ted" Wolf. It was originally intended as an attempt to profit from the success of previous similar shows like [[Masters of the Universe]].

The series follows the adventures of a group of catlike humanoid aliens with super powers. 

The cartoon, for which Leonard Starr was the head writer, became extremely popular and lasted 4 seasons. The animation for the episodes is notable because it actually was provided by the Japanese studio Pacific Animation Corporation, later acquired in 1989 to form Walt Disney Animation Japan. Thus the animation was made in an 80s anime style.

The series was originally distributed by Rankin-Bass Productions' then-parent company Telepictures Corporation, which would later merge with Lorimar Productions in 1986. In 1989 Lorimar-Telepictures was purchased by Warner Bros, who has owned the rights for the series since then.

There were also several comic book series produced: A [[Marvel]] Comics' version (currently owned by Warner Bros. rival Disney), 1984 to 1988; and five series by Wildstorm, an imprint of DC Comics (Warner Bros.' corporate sibling), beginning in 2003. Items of clothing featuring the ThunderCats logo and DVD boxsets of the original series have enjoyed a resurgence in recent years as nostalgia for the former children's favorite has grown.

A remake of the original ThunderCats animated series was produced by Warner Bros. Animation and began airing on Cartoon Network from July 2011. Animation production was being done by Japanese animation company Studio 4°C. Despite an early positive response the new series was cancelled after only one season because of low ratings.

h4. Characters

* [[Lion-O]]
* [[Cheetara]]
* [[WilyKit]]
* [[WilyKat]]
* [[Tygra]]
* [[Panthro]]
* [[Snarf]]
* [[Mumm-Ra]]
* [[Hachiman_(thundercats)|Hachiman]]
* [[Jackalman_(thundercats)|Jackalman]]

h4. See also

* [[Pacific Animation Corporation]]

title: the_turner_diaries
body:
The Turner Diaries is a 1978 novel by [[William Luther Pierce]], the founder and chairman of [[National Alliance]], an American white nationalist group, published under the pseudonym Andrew Macdonald. It was initially syndicated in the National Alliance publication Attack! from 1975–1978 before being published in paperback form by the National Alliance's publishing arm National Vanguard Books in 1978. As of 2001, the book had sold an estimated 300,000 copies, initially only available through mail order from the National Alliance. In 1996, it was republished by Barricade Books with a foreword that disavowed the novel. The Turner Diaries was described as being "explicitly racist and anti-Semitic" by [[The New York Times]].

The book has been influential in shaping white nationalism and the later development of the white genocide conspiracy theory. It has also inspired numerous hate crimes and acts of terrorism, including the 1984 assassination of [[Alan Berg]], the [[1995 Oklahoma City bombing]], and the [[1999 London nail bombings]]. It is estimated to have influenced perpetrators in over 200 killings. The phrase the "Day of the Rope" has also become popular in far-right and white nationalist circles.

title: picot_trim_panties
body:
[[Panties]] with a picot trim. Often seen in [[lingerie]].

Picot trim is a type of ornamental used in textiles and crafting. Picot trim typically features a decorative edging composed by a series of small loops or scallops along the edge of a fabric or ribbon.

The term "picot" originates from the French word for "small point". 

h4. Examples

title: degrees_of_lewdity
body:
Open-source text-based erotic life simulation game about an orphan who must make enough money by any means possible to satisfy their abusive caretaker. Noted for its dark content and themes, including rape, abuse, bullying, kidnapping, prostitution, chastity, corruption, and bestiality.

The player character is customizable (and transformable), and all NPCs can be configured to be either gender and have either set of genitalia; moreover, NPCs' appearances are only briefly described in text, and therefore greatly open to interpretation.

title: magaki_(kof)
body:
The final boss of [[The King of Fighters XI]].

His normal form is that of a handsome white-haired man wearing a white tuxedo jacket. But in his transformed state, his lower body becomes covered in black metal, his skin becomes pink, his hair turns sharper, and his personality also changes to the point that he despises humans so much that they shouldn't even exist.

He fights by spamming lasers to the point the player cannot even have a chance to attack him, hence his SNK Boss status.

Fanworks often pair him with [[Touhou]]'s [[Patchouli Knowledge]].

title: lolita_(nabokov)
body:
Umbrella tag for all iterations of [i]Lolita[/i], by Vladimir Nabokov.

Notable in history because Dolores Haze's nickname, Lolita, is the origin of the word "[[loli]]con". The term, being coined in Russell Trainer's pop psychology book The Lolita Complex (released 11 years after Lolita, 10 after the Japanese translation), would gain additional meaning in Japan beyond serving as a synonym for a [[pedophile]], being "used":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lETPaGnl2aI] equivalent to [[moe (phrase)|]] before that word gained traction in the 90s.

h4. Characters

* [[Dolores Haze]] (Lolita)

title: dragoon_(kirby)
body:
One of the legendary machines of [[Kirby Air Ride]], along with the [[Hydra (kirby)|]]. The Dragoon has a white/light pink body and multiple rainbow feathers on its back.

It can be used during City Trial mode when a player assembles all three of its parts, granting them superior speed and flight capability. It also appears in the [[Super Smash Bros.]] series with the same unlocking method, nearly guaranteeing a K.O. against targets on its path. The same distinction in this series is shared with the [[Daybreak (kid_icarus)|]].
H4. See also

title: yoru_mac
body:
[[McDonald's]] Japan's post-5pm menu line-up, known as Yoru Mac (literally "Night Mac", with the alternate name of "McDonald's in the Night"), introduced in June 2017 first in Aichi, Gifu and Mie Prefecture, before being expanded nation-wide in March 2018. Several different products have come and gone as part of the line-up, and in turn, so too have several advertising campaigns.

In Autumn 2023, one such advertisement campaign launched, running from late September to early November, focused on depicting characters (ex. a family, a group of friends, etc. hanging out together) happily enjoying items from the line-up, in commercials animated by [[uraura ura-chan]]. The main mascots of the campaign are a set of Halloween characters, originally first appearing in a Spring 2023 Yoru Mac advertising campaign called "Yoru Mac Manager", even receiving their own dedicated commercial (post #6713997). The six commercials that released would collectively be entitled the "Yoru Mac Anime Series" by McDonald's.

One of the commercials, depicting a [[mother (yoru mac)|]], [[father (yoru mac)|]] and [[daughter (yoru mac)|]] (post #6702154), unexpectedly went viral on western Twitter, resulting in tons of fanart. Later, another commercial featuring a [[boyfriend (yoru mac)|]] and [[girlfriend (yoru mac)|]] (post #6834868) received similar amounts of attention.

A year later, in Autumn 2024, coinciding with the "McDonald's Favorite Character Grand Prix":[https://twitter.com/McDonaldsJapan/status/1834766516807475527], another commercial featuring the family from the first commercial was made (post #8169424), with the Halloween character keychains being swapped out for a Grimace keychain.

h4. List of animated commercials

h5. 2023 Yoru Mac Anime Series

* post #6702154: [[Mother (yoru mac)|]], [[Father (yoru mac)|]] and [[Daughter (yoru mac)|]]
* post #6706301: Three Friends
* post #6713997: [[Dracula (yoru mac)|]], [[Frankenstein's Monster (yoru mac)|]], [[Mummy (yoru mac)|]], [[Werewolf (yoru mac)|]], and [[Witch (yoru mac)|]]
* post #6834868: [[Boyfriend (yoru mac)|]] and [[Girlfriend (yoru mac)|]]
* post #6840960: [[Fry-kun (yoru mac)|]], [[Fry-chan (yoru mac)|]], and [[Nugget-kun (yoru mac)|]]
* post #6847978: [[Single Gal (yoru mac)|]]

h5. 2024 commercials

* post #8169424: [[Mother (yoru mac)|]], [[Father (yoru mac)|]] and [[Daughter (yoru mac)|]]

* post #8197327: [[Boyfriend (yoru mac)|]] and [[Girlfriend (yoru mac)|]]

h4. External links

* "grape Japan: McDonald’s Japan reveals little known moneysaver on their exclusive nighttime menu":[https://grapeejapan.com/209553]

title: gundam_gp-01_full_vernian_zephyranthes
body:
[b]RX-78GP01Fb Full Vernian "Zephyranthes"[/b]

A refit to the original spec [[Gundam GP-01 Zephyranthes]] designed with space combat in mind after [[Kou Uraki]] heavily damaged the unit attempting to haphazardly send it into combat. With added verniers and thrusters, the Full Vernian (also referred to erroneously as the [i]Full Burnern[/i]) was a high-mobility, all-round top-class MS.

A black-and-white variant of its HGUC model kit was included as a Limited Edition bonus together with [[Linkin Park]]'s "A Thousand Suns" to commemorate "The Catalyst" being used as the opening for the arcade and PS3 game "Mobile Suit Gundam: Extreme Versus".

title: circle_skirt
body:
When a [[skirt]] or [[dress]] is spread out in a circle, maybe looking like a disk. The reason for this can vary:

* The dress is inherently designed to fan out like a disk on its own (post #3474471, post #8319807, post #1065045)
* The character is sitting down/kneeling/lying and spreading the dress around them (post #4551021, post #1170148, post #1140590)
* The [[dress lift|dress lifted]] or [[wind lift]] upward and spread flat (post #2579102, post #45559, post #2102833, post #7388110)
* The perspective is shown above the character (post #1997121, post #4023640, post #7932819)
* Similarly, it can be an [[upskirt]] where other elements like the wind or the character's legs assist in spreading the dress around (post #1121623, post #7601362, post #2372870)

h4. See Also

* [[dress flip]]

title: kabedon
body:
Kabedon (Japanese: 壁ドン; kabe, "wall", and don, "bang") is the popular trope of one character slapping their hand against the wall while the other character's back is currently against it, effectively locking them in. It is usually employed for romantic purposes.

When a foot is used instead of a hand, also use [[foot kabedon]]. Use [[kabedon on viewer]] for a kabedon in [[pov| first person]].

For the variant done while [[lying]], use [[yukadon]] instead.

title: large_clitoris
body:
A [[clitoris]] that is prominently large, but not unrealistic.  May protrude prominently from the [[clitoral hood]].

In humans testosterone can enlarge the clitoris. Some may purposefully make their clitoris larger as a body modification. Female [[bodybuilder]]s who use steroids may experience this unintentionally. Transgender men who take testosterone as hormone replacement may purposefully seek out this result. Some posts under [[cuntboy]] may depict transgender man, making the tag applicable in those cases. In transgender men, this is colloquially referred to as a "t-dick".

h4. See also

* [[huge clitoris]]

title: female_ejaculation
body:
The expulsion of [[pussy juice|fluid]] from the [[pussy|vagina]] during or after an [[female orgasm|orgasm]]. Colloquially known as 'squirting' or 'gushing'.

It can be hard to tell whether an image contains female ejaculation or [[peeing]], especially if the picture is [[monochrome]]. Female ejaculate is usually drawn white or clear as a strong gush, and there will usually be less of it than there would be if the subject was peeing. If you aren't sure which it is, use your best judgment when tagging. 

Not to be confused with the [[squirting liquid]] tag, which is for non-sexual expulsion of liquids. This tag implies a vagina, in case of a [[futanari]] ejaculating  [[ejaculating while penetrated]] shall be used instead.

h4. See also

title: parlor_dragonmaid
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 3
[b]Attribute:[/b] Wind
[b]Type:[/b] Dragon / Effect
[i]
If this card is Normal or Special Summoned : You can send 1 " Dragonmaid " card from your Deck to the GY , except "Parlor Dragonmaid". At the start of the Battle Phase : You can return this card to the hand , and if you do, Special Summon 1 Level 8 "Dragonmaid" monster from your hand or GY. You can only use each effect of "Parlor Dragonmaid" once per turn.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 500
[b]DEF:[/b] 1700

A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]] and one of the member of the Dragonmaid archetype. Also known as [[Dragonmaid Lorpar]] in her dragon form. She has a plant theming to her, complete with a leafy tail and wings.

Parlor Dragonmaid is notorious for binging on sweets to the point where she steals some behind [[Kitchen Dragonmaid]]'s back and even petitions her for more sweets. In fan arts, she is also often depicted as a sister figure to [[Laundry Dragonmaid]].
other_names: ドラゴンメイド・パルラ

At the start of the Battle Phase : You can return this card to the hand , and if you do, Special Summon 1 Level 7 "Dragonmaid" monster from your hand or GY. You can only use each effect of "Nurse Dragonmaid" once per turn.[/i]

A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]], part of the "Dragonmaid" archetype. Also known as [[Dragonmaid Ernus]] in her dragon form. Easily recognised by her pink [[nurse]] uniform. Nurse Dragonmaid appears as a careful and kind senior figure, or even as a sisterly figure, as she is often depicted caring for or worrying about [[Laundry Dragonmaid]] in official card art.

title: hank_j._wimbleton
body:
Main protagonist of the [[Madness Combat]] series. His appearance differs between installments, but tends to be frequently portrayed outside of the main story with his outfit from Madness Combat 7: [i]Consternation[/i].

Said outfit consists of a pair of [[black-framed eyewear|black-framed]] [[goggles]] with a [[red-tinted eyewear|red tint]], a [[black coat]] and [[black bandana]]s covering his head and mouth, [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], and [[bandages]] covering the wounds* received since the first installment.

* For reference purposes, the list of wounds can be found at "this link":[https://madnesscombat.fandom.com/wiki/Hank_J._Wimbleton#Deaths] ([b]Warning: Spoilers[/b]).

body:

title: sukonbu_(shirakami_fubuki)
body:
Mascots representing the fans of [[Shirakami Fubuki]], designed by [[shirakami fubuki (artist)|Fubuki]] herself.

They are tiny [[chibi]] white foxes with yellow tails surrounded by two green shrouds that, as a whole, resembles an ear of corn (maize), which is Fubuki's fan mark: 🌽. They also have Fubuki's earring and black inner ear fur and adds aqua facial streaks, three on the forehead and one on each cheek.

Depending on where they come from, the Sukonbu have different accessories assigned to them. The Sukonbu proper, the japanese fans, wear a scarf similar to Fubuki's in her original outfit. The "Friends", which are the foreign fans, wear ribbons similar to the one in Fubuki's lolita outfit. All of them have an accessory at the knot which resembles an orange X but is based on Gold Osmanthus blossoms.

That being said, Fubuki encourages her fans to personalize their Sukonbu avatars by adding or changing their accessories. They can also be given different eye colors other than simple black ovals, giving her green-blue eye color and Kurokami's red eye color as an example.

h4. Appearence

* !post #4545004: Reference sheet

title: comandante_cappellini_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Italian submarine [i]Comandante Cappellini[/i]. Character design by [[Jiji (aardvark)|]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] tied into [[twintails]] and with an [[ahoge]], and [[green eyes]]. Her default outfit (representing her Italian service) consists of a [[black vest]], [[black shorts]] underneath a [[black skirt]], [[black thighhighs|black]] [[thigh boots]], and a [[green bow|green]] [[hair bow]]. As [[UIT-24 (kancolle)|]] she wears a [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow]], and as [[I-503 (Kancolle)|]] she wears a [[pink bow|pink]] [[hair bow]].

The historical [i]Comandante Cappellini[/i] was seized by the Japanese after the Italian surrender in 1943 and handed over to Germany as [i]UIT-24[/i]. She was seized back by the Japanese after the German surrender in 1945 and commissioned as [i]I-503[/i].

h4. Appearance

title: mechanical_buddy_universe
body:
[[post-apocalypse|Post-apocalyptic]] science fiction setting by [[Kato Takuji]] (AKA Ishiyumi). Most stories in the setting generally involve a human paired off with a sapient robot character as their primary protagonists.

Four main stories are set in this universe:

* "The Story of a Droid":[/pools/16987]
* "Hawkeye in Love":[/pools/17005] 
* "The Banshee Cometh":[/pools/17015] 
* "Maid Would Want to Protect Her Lady":[/pools/17016]

In addition there are the side stories "The Story of an Manga Artist":[/pools/17081], and "Apparition":[/pools/17021] which technically takes place in the same universe.

Currently serialized by Square Enix as [b]Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0[/b].

h4. External links

* "Manga UP!: Mechanical Buddy Universe":https://global.manga-up.com/manga/234
* "Square Enix: Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0":https://magazine.jp.square-enix.com/yg/introduction/meka/
