title: elephant_toad_(mario)
body: [[Toad (mario)|]] (usually a [[Blue Toad (mario)|]] or a [[Yellow Toad (mario)|]]) transformed into an [[elephant]] when using the [[Elephant Fruit]], debuting in [i][[Super Mario Bros. Wonder]][/i].

title: shu_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
Titular deuteragonist of "Maid Would Want to Protect Her Lady":[/pools/17016], a story set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]]. Serves [[Cordelia herschel (mechanical buddy universe)|Milady]] as her personal attendant and bodyguard.

She is given the name "Shu" in the serialized manga "Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0", which is Chinese for "mouse".

title: akirara_(ishiyumi)
body: Namesake protagonist of "Mahou Shoujo aKIRARA":[/pools/17108], an original Twitter-hosted web series by [[Kato takuji]].

title: little_lass_(ishiyumi)
body:
小娘
[tn]"Little Girl"[/tn]

Supporting character of "The Goddess of the G-Spring":[/pools/17110], an original Twitter-hosted web series by [[Kato takuji]].

A childhood friend of [[Gunpla Boy (Ishiyumi)|Gunpla Boy]] from the same series. She lives in the same village as him and is concerned when he starts to spend more time in the spring (and by extension, the forest as well).

Later becomes a fan of the mecha series directed by [[Tomino Yoshiyuki]], [spoiler]after a prank gone horribly wrong by the [[G-Spring Goddess (Ishiyumi)|G-Spring Goddess]][/spoilers]. She has never been the same ever since, sporting blank stares and manic smiles, possibly due to the trauma.

Now plays the role of a concerned (cockblocking) 'friend' to prevent the boy from meeting the goddesses as much as possible, either by monopolizing his time or antagonizing them whenever they met (usually both). Her reason is presumed to be out of jealousy and madness.

title: twintailed_girl_(ishiyumi)
body:
Placeholder name.

Titular co-protagonist of "Girls Who Get It":[/pools/17139], an original Twitter-hosted web series by [[Kato takuji]].

Twin-tailed schoolgirl with an interest in mecha and robots. 

Friend to her long-haired counterpart, [[Long-Haired GIRL (ishiyumi)|]].

title: maid_mage_(ishiyumi)
body:
[i]Placeholder name.[/i]

Supporting character in "Isekai Yuusha":[/pools/17175], a [[Yuusha series]]-inspired original Twitter-hosted web series by [[Kato takuji]]. 

A young-looking palace maid/'lady-in-waiting' who also happens to be an apprentice court mage (self declared). Dresses in mage robes and wears a [[witch_hat|mage hat]]. Often carries a wooden [[mage staff]] with a distinctive curl on one end. She has [[freckles]] on her face.

title: dahlia_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
[tn]"Sister/Nun (Banshee Squad Captain)"[/tn]

Protagonist of "The Banshee Cometh":[/pools/17015], a story set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]].

A grizzled veteran and former captain of Banshee Squad, an all-female squad of AugMech pilots. Speaks in a distinctive dialect that is rendered as "Irish English" (a broad mixture of several Hiberno-English dialects) on Danbooru translations.

She is given the name "Dahlia" in the serialized manga "Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0".
other_names: シスター(泣き女・隊長)

title: tonfa_guy_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
[i]Placeholder name.[/i]

Minor character and antagonist in several stories set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]].

Dual-wields electric [[tonfa]]s and wears a distinctive visored combat helmet that conceals his eyes. Has [[medium_hair|noticeably long]] sidelocks that poke out under his helmet to around chest-level.

title: g-flame_goddess_(ishiyumi)
body:
[tn]"Goddess of the Flame of G"[/tn]

Supporting character of "The Goddess of the G-Spring":[/pools/17110], an original Twitter-hosted web series by [[Kato takuji]].

A fan of [[G Gundam]] and [[Crossbone Gundam]], along with their associated Gundam model kits ([[Gunpla]]).

There's a running gag of her being flamed on social media sites, as a meta pun on her name.

title: long-haired_girl_(ishiyumi)
body:
Placeholder name.

Titular co-protagonist of "Girls Who Get It":[/pools/17139], an original Twitter-hosted web series by [[Kato takuji]].

Long-haired schoolgirl with an interest in mecha and robots. Also has an interest in building Gundam model kits ([[Gunpla]]). She highly resembles [[Suzuya_(kancolle)]] in terms of dress and appearance. Has brown hair though.

Friend to her twintailed counterpart, [[Twintailed GIRL_(ishiyumi)|]].

title: brave_princess_(ishiyumi)
body:
Co-protagonist of "Isekai Yuusha":[/pools/17175], a [[Yuusha series]]-inspired original Twitter-hosted web series by [[Kato takuji]]. 

A medieval fantasy princess who somehow ended up as the human partner of [[XE-Shine_(ishiyumi)|]].

title: crybaby_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
Primary viewpoint character in the "Records" and "Crybaby" arcs of "The Banshee Cometh":[/pools/17015], a story set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]].

Speaks in a timid tone and is prone to crying. Sometimes has a potty mouth during emotional moments.

Later earns the callsign "Crying Lady" due to her battle achievements. She would eventually become the captain of Banshee Squad, an all-female squad of AugMech pilots.

Past self of [[Dahlia (mechanical Buddy Universe)|]]. Avoid tagging one character with the other (unless they both appear as separate characters), as they both have different appearances and speech patterns.

title: cordelia_herschel_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
Protagonist of "Maid Would Want to Protect Her Lady":[/pools/17016], a story set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]].

Young mistress of an affluent household unravaged by the wars in the Mechanical Buddy Universe. The [[Shu (mechanical buddy universe)|]] is her personal attendant and bodyguard.

She is given the name "Cordelia Herschel" (コーディリア・ハーシェル) in the serialized manga "Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0".

Is secretly an android taking the place of the 'real' [[Cordelia herschel (young) (mechanical buddy universe)|Milady]], a posthumous character.

title: knight's_&_magic
body:
[i]Knight's & Magic[/i] is a Japanese web and light novel series written by Amazake No Hisago and illustrated by [[Kurogin]]. An anime series ran from July 2 to September 24, 2017. A manga adaptation is currently ongoing, and is illustrated by [[Kato takuji]].

The series features an isekai story where a [[model kit]] enthusiast is reincarnated into a [[fantasy]] world with [[mecha]].

h4. Characters

* [[Ernesti Echevalier]]
* [[Adeltrud Walter]]
* [[Archid Walter]]
* [[Helvi Oberg]]
* [[Stefania Celarti]]

h4. Mecha

* [[Gordoleo]]
* [[Ikaruga (knight's & magic)|]]
* [[Saldotoah]]
* [[Telestale]]
* [[Tzendolg]]

title: mangabot_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
Titular deuteragonist of "The Story of a Manga Artist":[/pools/17081], a side story set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]]. His name is revealed to be "Airget" in the serialized manga "Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0".

Employer of the [[Assistant_(mechanical_buddy_universe)|]].

title: goggles_guy_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
Minor supporting character of "The Story of a Droid":[/pools/16987], a story set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]]. His name is revealed to be "John" in the serialized manga "Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0".

Wears a helmet and distinctive combat goggles in most of his appearances. Often appears together with [[Mohawk Guy_(mechanical_buddy_universe)|]].

title: devil's_hand_(ishiyumi)
body:
Titular 'villain' protagonist of "The Devil's Hand at Your Heels":[/pools/17029], an original Twitter-hosted web series by [[Kato takuji]].

She's [spoiler]an insectoid shapeshifter that can take on the form of a human girl. With [[The Thing]]-esque body horror vibes.[/spoiler]

title: ophelia_herschel_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
Little sister of [[cordelia herschel (young) (mechanical buddy universe)|Milady]] from [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe]].

She is given the name "Ophelia Herschel" (オフィーリア・ハーシェル) in the serialized manga "Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0".

Primary antagonist of the "Maid Would Want to Protect Her Lady":[/pools/17016] storyline.

title: jukebox_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
Supporting protagonist of "The Banshee Cometh":[/pools/17015], a story set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]].

Resembles a desktop computer tower unit, with a single eye and a speaker grille in front. Has a collapsible handle allowing it to be hauled around like a suitcase. Plugs into the [[Dahlia (mechanical Buddy Universe)|Banshee Sister]]'s personal command-variant [[Diva_Duo_(Mechanical_Buddy_Universe)|Diva Duo]] as an auxiliary AI core, similar to how certain [[Haro]] units are used in Gundam series set in the Anno Domini timeline.
other_names: 神父(ジュークボックス)
拡戦車のサポートコアユニット

title: cyborg_git_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
[i]Placeholder name.[/i]

Minor antagonist in several stories set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]].

A cyborg with a [[mechanical eye|mechanical left eye]] and a noticeably [[single_mechanical_arm|mechanical left arm]]. Often appears together with [[Punk Git_(mechanical_buddy_universe)|]].

title: kuchisake-onna_(ishiyumi)
body: [[Kato takuji]]'s take on the [[Kuchisake-onna]] creepypasta urban legend. 'Villain' protagonist of Ishiyumi's "Apparition":[/pools/17021] series.

title: ma_no_mono-tachi
body:
A [[fantasy]] setting created by [[Kato takuji]], focusing primarily on groups of [[monster]]s and demons, their interactions with humans, and the hijinks that ensue. The series is comprised of two webcomics:

* "Sir Liebe von Trapp":[/pools/17326]
* "The Devil's Hand at Your Heels":[/pools/17029]

A serialized manga adaptation of the setting illustrated by [[gashi-gashi]] was announced in 2022, titled [[Ma no Mono-tachi wa Kuwadateru]].

h4. See Also
* "Twitter Event":[https://twitter.com/i/events/1495765061297909763] - compilation of posts from both webcomics.

title: akira-kun_(ishiyumi)
body:
Protagonist of "Mahou Shoujo aKIRARA":[/pools/17108], an original Twitter-hosted web series by [[Kato takuji]].

[spoiler]The civilian identity of [[Akirara_(Ishiyumi)|Magical Girl Akirara]].[/spoiler]

title: xe-shine_(ishiyumi)
body:
Titular co-protagonist of "Isekai Yuusha":[/pools/17175], a [[Yuusha series]]-inspired original Twitter-hosted web series by [[Kato takuji]]. 

A humanoid [[super robot]] mecha with a human-looking face, with similar design aesthetics as protagonist super robots from the [[Yuusha series]] (and [[Transformers]], as the Yuusha series were initially based on G1 Takara Transformers designs). Can transform into a car mode.

The "XE" is pronounced as one word, approximately "Gzee" (/ɡziː/). This "XE" is ultimately derived from Japanese "Ten'i" (Displaced); see the artist commentary notes on post #3797310 where the artist explains the derivation of his name.

[spoiler]His actual name is technically just "Shine", with XE-Shine being the name of his powered-up self. XE has been added to the tag to better disambiguate his name.[/spoiler]

Robot partner of [[Brave Princess (Ishiyumi)|]].

title: g-spring_goddess_(ishiyumi)
body:
[tn]"Goddess of the Spring of G", "The Goddess of the Fountain of G" (translation used in the title of one of the author's print books)[/tn]

Namesake protagonist of "The Goddess of the G-Spring":[/pools/17110], an original Twitter-hosted web series by [[Kato takuji]]. She is based on the "Goddess of the Spring" archetype from the Japanese variation of the [[Honest Axe]] fable.

Hardcore fan of various Gundam series and their associated model kits ([[Gunpla]]). Has a preference for submersible Mobile Suits, as befits her element. 

She is also a fan of other mecha series, especially those featuring either [[Tomino Yoshiyuki]] as the director or [[Izubuchi Yutaka]] as the mecha designer.

Has a (violent) rivalry with [[g-forest_goddess_(ishiyumi)|G-Forest Goddess]] where they clash about various Gundam topics and followers, which often ends in a fistfight. She always loses due to type disadvantage ([[pokemon|Pokemon]] style: water loses to grass) and being fairly weak in general.

[[gunpla_boy_(ishiyumi)|Gunpla Boy]] is her one and only follower/pupil, whom she had taken a certain liking to.

title: punk_git_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
[i]Placeholder name.[/i]

Minor antagonist in several stories set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]].

Dresses as a stereotypical punk, with a tall mohawk and a leather vest jacket. Usually armed with a [[revolver]]. Often appears together with [[Cyborg Git_(mechanical_buddy_universe)|]].

title: girphan_(ishiyumi)
body:
Mecha character from "Girls Who Get It":[/pools/17139], an original Twitter-hosted web series by [[Kato takuji]].

Resembles the [[Arx-7 arbalest|ARX-7 Arbalest]] from [[Full Metal Panic!]], but with a different head unit. 

Girphan is often used as a stand-in for the 'protagonist mecha' in imagined scenarios thought up by the GIRLS who get it, or in [[model kit|model kits]] worked on by the same. 

[spoiler]Becomes an actual sentient character later in the story.[/spoiler]

title: hawkeyes_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
Composite character from "Hawkeye in Love":[/pools/17005], a story set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]].

The combined 'superhero' alter-ego of the [[Parts Shop Geezer_(Mechanical_Buddy_Universe)|]]'s [[riika rikkinen (mechanical buddy universe)|granddaughter]] and [[TGP11S Hawkeye_(mechanical_buddy_universe)|]], with the former wearing the latter as a power suit.

Commonly depicted holding a sniper rifle. Wears a hooded cloak with a prominent hawk's beak set in the center-front of the hood, similar to the eagle-beaked hood worn by [[altair_ibn_la-ahad|Altair]] and other Assassin's Creed characters.
other_names: 鷹の双眸『ホークアイズ』

title: parts_shop_geezer_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
Supporting character in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]]. Runs a small store/workshop selling weapons and robot/cyborg parts. Grandfather to [[TGP11S Hawkeye (Mechanical_Buddy_Universe)|]]'s paramour. 

His left arm is a cybernetic prosthetic, but this is usually not detailed enough to be seen clearly on most of his appearances in the MBU comics.
other_names: パーツ屋のじいちゃん

title: teke-teke_(ishiyumi)
body:
[[Kato takuji]]'s take on the [[Teke-Teke]] creepypasta urban legend. Supporting character in Ishiyumi's "Apparition":[/pools/17021] series.  

h4. See also:

** The original creepypasta that this character is based on.

title: ma_no_mono-tachi_wa_kuwadateru
body: A published manga based on [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Ma no Mono-tachi]] setting, featuring illustrations by [[gashi-gashi]]. Began publication in March 2023.
other_names: 魔のものたちは企てる

title: mohawk_guy_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
Minor supporting character of "The Story of a Droid":[/pools/16987], a story set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]]. His name is revealed to be "Darryl" in the serialized manga "Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0".

Styles his hair in a distinctive mohawk. Often appears together with [[Goggles Guy_(mechanical_buddy_universe)|]].

title: chuchumy_(ishiyumi)
body:
チュチュミィ、 魚さん
[tn]"Chuchumy", "Mr. Fishy"[/tn]

Supporting character of "The Goddess of the G-Spring":[/pools/17110], an original Twitter-hosted web series by [[Kato takuji]]. 

One of the many talking fish(es) that lives in the G-Spring where the [[G-Spring Goddess (ishiyumi)|]] dwells. Named Chuchumy by the Goddess, after [[Raraiya Monday]]'s [[Chuchumy|pet goldfish]]. Other characters refer to it as "Mr. Fishy".

All the Spring fish(es) are called Chuchumy by the Goddess, so only use this tag when one of the Fishes acts like a 'character' (speaking or visibly reacting counts), and/or when [spoiler]it takes on the form of a humanoid 'fish girl' who shares an uncanny resemblance with Raraiya Monday.[/spoiler].

title: queenie_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
Supporting character of "The Story of a Droid":[/pools/16987], a story set in [[Kato takuji]]'s [[Mechanical Buddy Universe|]].

Speaks in classic onee-kotoba ("Big Sisters' Speech", "camp feminine speech", see "here":[https://www.tofugu.com/japanese/queer-japanese/#word-choice] for a nuanced explanation). Tends to ham up the 'camp' in certain situations, including when dressing up [[Blau (mechanical buddy universe)|]] and [[Son of Droid_(mechanical_buddy_universe)|Son]], or when reacting to comedic situations.

Is given the name "Victoria Venera" in the serialized manga "Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0"

title: noppera-bou_(ishiyumi)
body:
のっぺらぼう
[tn]"Noppera-onna" ([i]lit.[/i] faceless man)[/tn]

[[Kato takuji]]'s take on the [[noppera-bou]] Japanese youkai. Deuteragonist of Ishiyumi's "Apparition":[/pools/17021] series. A faceless cyborg man capable of imitating other people.

He is given the name "Joey" in the serialized manga "Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0".

title: lily_everhart
body:
Lily Everhart the Snowfall Sovereign, founder of the Free Pal Alliance and an enemy boss from [[Palworld]].

Lily has [[medium hair|medium length]] [[white hair]] and [[purple eyes]], wears a [[green dress|green]] [[single-shoulder dress]] with a [[black tube top]] and [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[white sleeves]].

She rides her [[Pal (creature)|]] [[Lyleen]] in combat, and carries a [[spear]] on her [[holding polearm behind back|back]].

title: holding_polearm_behind_back
body:
A character is holding any sort of long polearm behind their back, rather than in front of them. The 'polearm' in question can be anything like a [[spear]], [[staff]], [[broom]], rod, or such. This tag basically encompasses the variety of postures that characters can utilize to accomplish this.

Note that this tag refers to when a polearm is actually being [b]held[/b] in the character's hands. If it's strapped to their back, planted in the ground behind them, or they're otherwise not holding it, don't use this tag.

body: [[Toad (mario)|]] (usually a [[Blue Toad (mario)|]]) in a [[cat costume]] when using the [[Super Bell]], debuting in [i][[Super Mario 3D World]][/i].

body:
[[Toad (mario)|]] as he appears in [[Dr. Mario World]]. 

He is dressed as a [[doctor]] with a [[head mirror]], [[white coat]], [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]], [[blue necktie]] and [[brown pants]]. He's also carrying a [[brown bag|brown]] [[shoulder bag]].

title: hint_toad_(mario)
body:
A member of [[Captain Toad]]'s Toad Brigade, debuting in [i][[Super Mario Galaxy]][/i]. 

He is a [[Blue Toad (mario)|]] with [[glasses]] and dressed as a explorer.

title: kinopio-kun
body:
A [[Green Toad (mario)|]] that is the mascot of [[Nintendo]]'s [[line_(naver)|LINE]] social media account. He would comment on various upcoming Nintendo products. 

His mushroom cap head is green while the spots on them are white, which are inverted colors from the usual Green Toad and resembles that of a [[1-up Mushroom]].

title: lingering_will_(kingdom_hearts)
body:
Enigmatic entity in [[full armor]] fought as a high difficulty optional boss in [[Kingdom Hearts II|Kingdom Hearts II Final Mix]]. Wields the [[Ends of the Earth]] [[keyblade]]. 

[spoiler]Is the thoughts of [[Terra (Kingdom Hearts)|]] animated into his keyblade armor after his body is stolen by [[Xehanort]] and his heart is sealed away. Considered a separate character from Terra. Not to be confused visually with Terra wearing his keyblade armor; use context or artist's tags/description to differentiate the two.[/spoiler]

title: kikuchi_makoto
body:
One of the main characters of the [[Idolmaster]] series.
Honest, sensitive 16-year-old Makoto's [[reverse trap|boyish]] looks (having been raised as a boy by her father, who wanted one) and skill at sports pigeonholed her into becoming a "pretty-boy idol", much to her chagrin, having originally joined the studio in order to become more feminine.

Makoto's theme color is black, and she is voiced by [[Hirata Hiromi]].

* !asset #25478291: [[Idolmaster 1]] / [[Idolmaster Live for You!|Live for You!]]
* !asset #25478304: [[Idolmaster SP]]
* !asset #25478388: [[Idolmaster One for All|One for All]]
* !asset #25478448: [[Idolmaster Platinum Stars|Platinum Stars]] / [[Idolmaster Stella Stage|Stella Stage]] / [[Idolmaster Starlit Season|Starlit Season]]
* !asset #25478428: [[Idolmaster Million Live! Theater Days|Theater Days]]

* Age: 16 → 17
* Height: 157 cm → 159 cm
* Weight: 42 kg → 44 kg
* Birthday: August 29th
* Horoscope: Virgo ♍
* Blood type: O
* Three sizes: 73-56-76 → 75-57-78
* Hobbies: All sports, Collecting stuffed animals 
* Likes: Shoujo manga and mineral water
* Dislikes: Bugs and sports drinks
* Writing Hand: Right

title: assassin's_creed:_odyssey
body: The eleventh installment of the [[Assassin's Creed (series)|]] series, set in the Archidamian phase of the Peloponnesian War between the years 431 and 422 BCE. The protagonist is the Eagle Bearer, either [[Alexios (assassin's creed)|]] or [[Kassandra of Sparta|Kassandra]] by player choice.
other_names: アサシンクリードオデッセイ

title: sleeveless
body:
A [[shirt]], [[dress]], or other top with a neck but without sleeves, often revealing [[bare arms]].

On Pixiv, the tag "アメリカンスリーブ":http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%82%A2%E3%83%A1%E3%83%AA%E3%82%AB%E3%83%B3%E3%82%B9%E3%83%AA%E3%83%BC%E3%83%96 (American Sleeve) is used to denote a kind of sleeveless clothing where the armholes are cut near the base of the neck to the lower armpit, leaving a large portion of the shoulders bare. This is also typically a [[sleeveless turtleneck]].

This tag may be used for tops with [[detached sleeves]], but not for [[strapless]], [[halterneck]], [[off-shoulder shirt|off-shoulder]], or [[spaghetti strap]] tops. See the differences below.

h4. Examples

* !asset #23066879: Sleeveless
* !asset #23066884: [[Strapless]]
* !asset #23066882: [[Criss-cross halter]]

h4. See also

* [[strapless]]
* [[halterneck]]
* [[low-cut armhole]]
* [[Tag group:sleeves]]

title: sylux_(metroid)
body:
A [[Metroid]] character that debuted in [i][[Metroid Prime Hunters]][/i] as a rival and in multiplayer one of the seven playable Bounty Hunters. 

He harbors an extreme hatred for the Galactic Federation and [[Samus Aran]] by proxy, and seems to silently track her movements. His [[power armor|power suit]] and [[starfighter|ship]], the [[Delano 7]], is stolen Federation property.

Visually he is entirely covered with an angular blue suit that is lit with [[neon trim]]s. Attached to his right arm is a [[Arm Mounted Weapon|mounted weapon]] that shoots [[electricity]] called the Shock Coil.

Use this tag when the legs are not covered by clothes (including footwear) from the thighs until the middle of the shins.
Images should only have this tag if you can tell from the image that this is the case, meaning that all or almost all of this part of the leg must be in the picture.

body: Ibanez S/SA line of solid body [[electric guitar|electric guitars]]. Shares the general body and headstock shape with more common [[ibanez_rg|Ibanez RG]] with the key difference of having a much thinner, more rounded body shape. This resulted in the output jack being moved to the front of the body and mounted at a very shallow angle, producing the signature look of S and SA series.

title: shinki_(touhou)
body:
The demonic god-queen of [[Makai (Touhou)|Makai]] and the last boss of the fifth [[Touhou (PC-98)|Touhou PC-98]] game, [[Mystic Square]]. She created Makai and everything in it. She is thus considered to be the mother or foster-mother of [[Alice Margatroid (PC-98)|]], the stage 3 boss of Mystic Square and also the Extra stage boss.

She is sometimes depicted as being friends with [[Undefined Fantastic Object]]'s last boss, [[Hijiri Byakuren]], since one of her attacks, "Devil's Recitation", is a spellcard version of Shinki's final bullet pattern from Mystic Square. Since Byakuren was sealed in a portion of Makai, this effectively made Shinki her jailer, granting them an opportunity to interact.

title: falklands_war
body:
[b]The Falklands War[/b] ([[spanish_text|Spanish]]: [i]Guerra de Las Malvinas[/i]) was a ten-week undeclared war between [[Argentina]] and the [[United Kingdom]] in 1982 over two British dependent territories in the South Atlantic: the [[Falkland Islands]] and its territorial dependency, South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands. 

The conflict began on 2 April 1982, when Argentina invaded and occupied the Falkland Islands, followed by the invasion of South Georgia the next day. On 5 April, the British government dispatched a naval task force to engage the Argentine Navy and Air Force before making an amphibious assault on the islands. The conflict lasted 74 days and ended with an Argentine surrender on 14 June, returning the islands to British control. In total, 649 Argentine [[military]] personnel, 255 British military personnel, and three Falkland Islanders were killed during the hostilities.

The conflict was a major [[Cold War]] episode in the protracted dispute over the territories' sovereignty. Argentina asserted (and maintains) that the islands are Argentine territory, and the Argentine government thus described its military action as the reclamation of its own territory. The British government regarded the action as an invasion of a territory that had been a Crown colony since 1841. Falkland Islanders, who have inhabited the islands since the early 19th century, are predominantly descendants of British settlers, and strongly favour British sovereignty and culture.  

The conflict had a strong effect in both countries and has been the subject of various books, articles, films, and songs. Patriotic sentiment ran high in Argentina, but the unfavourable outcome prompted large protests against the ruling military government, hastening its downfall and the democratisation of the country. In the United Kingdom, the Conservative government, bolstered by the successful outcome, was re-elected with an increased majority the following year.  

Diplomatic relations between the United Kingdom and Argentina were restored in 1989 following a meeting in Madrid. The islands continue to operate as a self-governing British Overseas Territory.
other_names: フォークランドふんそう

title: the_fourth_power
body:
A hard [[science fiction]] graphic novel created entirely by notable sci-fi artist [[Juan Gimenez]] and published in 1989.

[b]The Fourth Power[/b] is a story with a female protagonist that is set in the far future. It deals with the concepts of space colonization, political intrigue and "transhumanism":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transhumanism . 

The title of the work refers to the actual definition of the "Fourth Power":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fourth_power used in arithmetic and algebra.

* [[Mega Exether]]

title: soldier_boy_(the_boys)
body:
A fictional superhero character from [[The Boys]].

[b]Soldier Boy[/b] is a [[parody]] of [[Captain America]], but very brutal, sadistic and with severe [[PTSD]].

He has super human strength and resilience and is armed with a [[m1911]], a Bowie [[knife]] and a very heavy Titanium [[shield]]. Also wears a military green [[superhero costume]] with a mask. 

In the TV show Soldier Boy has the ability to produce a very destructive high [[radiation]] energy blast [spoilers]that can remove compound V from any superpowered individual's body, turning them into regular people. He also is a [[World War II]] combat veteran and apparently never ages (or ages slower than regular humans). Currently in deep hybernation at a secret laboratory.[/spoilers].

title: tem_ray
body:
A character from the [[Gundam]] series. He first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] TV series from 1979. Also plays an important part in [[Mobile Suit Gundam The Origin]].

[b]Tem Ray[/b] is a very intelligent [[Earth Federation]] [[scientist]] and [[engineer]] who helped to create the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] [[mobile suit]]. He is the father of [[Amuro Ray]] and the husband of [[Kamaria Ray]].

[spoilers]During the [[Zeon]] attack on the colony where the first Gundam was being tested he is sucked out into space after an explosion breaches the hull of the facility. Fortunately he survives as Tem was wearing a [[spacesuit]]. However, due to a prolonged exposure to hypoxia as he was rescued after his suit's oxygen reserves were almost depleted, Tem's brain is damaged permanently beyond recovery and develops symptoms of dementia.[/spoilers] 

[spoilers]Later in the series his son [[Amuro Ray]] visits him and becomes shocked by Tem's mental condition. Sometime afterwards a [[crazy]] and disturbed Tem is last seen falling from the stairs of his apartment and his final fate is left uncertain.[/spoilers]

h4. See also
* [[Tem Ray's Circuit]]

title: shouyudai
body: Literally translates to "soy sauce fish". This is the generic Japanese name for those tiny fish-shaped [[soy sauce]] [[bottle]]s that are often packed into Asian cuisine takeaway meals (although they're starting to become less common nowadays due to plastic waste concerns). They were originally invented by the Japanese company "Asahi Sougyou":[http://www.asahi-so.co.jp/lunch/], which still makes and sells them under the "LunCharm" brand name.

title: yamato_nadeshiko_(hyakkano)
body:
Character from [[Kimi no Koto ga Dai Dai Dai Dai Daisuki na 100-nin no Kanojo]]. [[Aijou Rentarou]]'s thirteenth girlfriend, moving in from America to teach Japanese (not English as you'd expect). Usually called "Naddy" by her students.

[spoiler]She is actually a full-blooded Japanese woman, and barely speaks any English. She really likes America's concept of freedom.[/spoiler]

title: touhou_lensed_night_sky_kaseigai
body:
Touhou Lensed Night Sky, Kaseigai is a nontraditional bullet hell that focuses on a fully modular loadout. The player's own attacks and special effects can be exchanged midway through runs as the situation demands, or simply for fun.

There are a lot of ways to approach the game, with three playable characters, four major difficulty options, and a myriad of challenges and difficulty-lowering options that can be enabled or disabled at will.

title: renamon
body:
Beast Man-type Child-level [[Digimon]] that debuted in [[Digimon Tamers]] in 2001. In the series, Renamon features as [[Makino Ruki]]'s partner Digimon and is therefore one of the show's main characters.

Renamon appears as a [[furry female|furry]] [[fox girl]] with [[yellow fur|yellow]]/[[orange fur|orange]] and [[white fur|white]] [[body fur]] wth a [[neck fur|neck tuft]], [[black sclera]] with [[blue eyes]], a [[facial mark]] beneath one eye, and a [[leg tattoo]].

[u]Common evolutionary throughline:[/u]
[[Relemon]] -> [[Pokomon (digimon)|]] -> [b]Renamon[/b] -> [[Kyuubimon]] -> [[Taomon]] -> [[Sakuyamon]].
* Renamon can further evolve upon exposure to the [[Renamon X-Antibody|X-Antibody]].

title: thousand-men_pin
body: Relic from [[Made In Abyss]].  Grants immense strength to the user.

title: sakuyamon
body:
Ultimate-level God Man-type [[Digimon (creature)|Digimon]] that debuted in [[Digimon Tamers]] in 2001. Sakuyamon is often demonstrated as the Ultimate form of [[Renamon]]. Sakuyamon has the appearance of a [[miko]], but [[nontraditional miko|with an unusual choice of attire]], including [[gold armor]] consisting of a [[mask]] and [[breastplate]] over a [[black bodysuit|black]] [[bodysuit]]. It typically has [[medium breasts|medium]] to [[large breasts]] ranging between depictions and wields a [[shakujou]]. Sakuyamon is also accompanied by four kuda-gitsune shikigami at all times.

In Digimon Tamers, Sakuyamon is the Ultimate Evolution of [[Makino Ruki]]'s partner Renamon, achieved when Ruki and Renamon Matrix Evolve together.

[u]Common evolutionary throughline:[/u]
[[Relemon]] -> [[Pokomon (Digimon)|]] -> [[Renamon]] -> [[Kyuubimon]] -> [[Taomon]] -> [b]Sakuyamon[/b].
* Sakuyamon has a Mode Change called [[Sakuyamon: Miko Mode|Miko Mode]].
* Sakuyamon evolves further upon exposure to the [[Sakuyamon X-Antibody|X-Antibody]].
* Sakuyamon has a purple-colored counterpart named [[Kuzuhamon]], which is of a lower standing as Sakuyamon itself.

title: kashimashi
body:
A [[yuri]] manga drawn by [[Katsura Yukimaru]] with story by Akahori Satoru (赤堀悟). The story focuses on [[Osaragi Hazumu]], a normal, albeit effeminate high school boy who is killed when an [[ufo|alien spaceship]] crash lands on him, only to be restored to health [[genderswap (mtf)|as a girl]]. This results in a same-sex [[love triangle]] that Hazumu finds herself in with two of her best female friends.

title: alucard_(castlevania)
body:
Full name: Adrian Fahrenheit Țepeș (also Adrian Farenheights Tepes).

The son of [[Dracula (castlevania)|Count Dracula]] and a human woman named [[Lisa Tepes|Lisa]]. A recurring protagonist of the [[Castlevania (series)|]] series of video games, he first appeared as a guest character in [[Castlevania III: Dracula's Curse]] and became the main playable character in [[Castlevania: Symphony of the Night]], which marked the first time a non-Belmont and non-whip user took center stage.

His 21st century alias is [[Arikado Genya]].

h4. External links

* "pixiv Encyclopedia Entry (Japanese)":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%82%A2%E3%83%AB%E3%82%AB%E3%83%BC%E3%83%89]

title: dracula_(castlevania)
body:
A prominent antagonist in the [[Castlevania (series)|]] video game series, there known as Vlad Țepeș Dracula. In this series, his appearance has shifted between entries, though he usually retains a gentlemanly air. However, his demonic transformations run a wide gauntlet. His son is Adrian Fahrenheit Țepeș (who is most often seen going by the name "[[Alucard (Castlevania)|]]", Dracula backwards, in defiance of his evil father), and his main confidant and right-hand is [[Death (Castlevania)|]] (the Grim Reaper).

h4. See Also

* [[Dracula]]
other_names: ドラキュラ(悪魔城ドラキュラ)

title: danganronpa_v3:_killing_harmony
body:
[i][b]New Danganronpa V3: Everyone's New Semester of Killing[/b][/i] is the third main title in the [[Danganronpa (series)|]] visual novel series, developed by Spike Chunsoft. Separate from the Hope's Peak saga, the story instead follows a group of students recognised by the government's "Ultimates" sponsorship program held prisoner in [[Monokuma]]'s Gifted Inmates Academy. It was released on January 12, 2017. In September 2017, it was released in English under the title [i]Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony[/i].

title: gomen_yuuka
body:
A [[Blue Archive]] meme about [[Yuuka (Blue Archive)|]] being [[reverse netorare|cuckolded]] by someone else (usually [[Noa (Blue Archive)|]]) by stealing [[Sensei (Blue Archive)|]], who she has a crush on.

The meme is often accompanied by Noa's catchphase "I'm sorry Yuuka" (ごめユウカ - gomen yuuka), though this is used in a more passive aggressive manner.

Spin-offs of this meme include Gomen Noa (a [[role reversal|]]), Gomen Hina (Sensei being stolen away from [[Hina (Blue Archive)|]],  usually by [[Iroha (Blue Archive)|]]), or Gomen Fuuka ([[Fuuka (Blue Archive)|]] suffering at the hands of the Gourmet Research Society).

h4. See also
* [[Gomen Yui]]

title: pokemon_adventures
body:
[b]Pokemon Adventures[/b] (Japanese: [i]Pocket Monsters SPECIAL[/i], also known as [i]Pokémon Special[/i]) is a long-running manga series based on the [[pokemon|Pokémon]] games.

The series is written by Hidenori Kusaka and illustrated by [[Mato (mato-san_no_hon)|]] for the first 9 volumes. When Mato became ill and was unable to continue illustrating the series, [[Yamamoto Satoshi]] took over as the illustrator and still continues as the series' artist.

h4. Main characters

* Generation I: [[Red (pokemon)|]], [[Blue Oak]], [[Green (pokemon)|]], [[Yellow (pokemon)|]]
* Generation II:  [[Ethan (pokemon)|Gold]], [[Silver_(pokemon)|]], [[Kris (pokemon)|Crystal]]
* Generation III:  [[Brendan (pokemon)|Ruby]], [[may (pokemon)|Sapphire]], [[Emerald_(pokemon)|]]
* Generation IV:  [[Lucas (pokemon)|Diamond]], [[Barry (pokemon)|Pearl]], [[dawn (pokemon)|Platinum]] ("Ojousama")
* Generation V: [[Hilbert (pokemon)|Black]], [[Hilda (pokemon)|White]], [[Nate (pokemon)|Blake]], [[Rosa (pokemon)|Whitley]]
* Generation VI: [[Calem (pokemon)|X]], [[Serena (pokemon)|Yvonne]] (Y)
* Generation VII: [[Elio (pokemon)|Sun]], [[Selene (pokemon)|Moon]]
* Generation VIII: [[Victor (pokemon)|Henry Sword]], [[Gloria (pokemon)|Casey Shield]]
* Generation IX: [[Florian (pokemon)|Violet Lang]], [[Juliana (pokemon)|Scarlet Koito]]


h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Pokemon Adventures":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pokémon_Adventures

title: thomas_edison_(fate)
body:
A Caster-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] first appearing in the [[E Pluribus Unum (fate/grand order)|]] singularity. A depiction of the (in)famous inventor and businessman of the same name. Has a rivalry with [[Nikola Tesla (fate)|]].

He's tall and [[muscular]], has a white [[lion]] [[animal head|head]], and wears a [[blue bodysuit]] and [[red gloves]]. In his later ascensions, he gains [[light bulb]]s on both shoulders and rainbow wings.

[spoilers]His appearance is a result of an attempt by the government of the [[United States]] to create a servant that is "the manifestation of the American Dream" to protect the country by merging his heroic spirit with various heroic spirits of United States presidents and the concept of [i]American Dream[/i]. Essentially turned Edison into a physical manifestation of the United States.[/spoilers]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Pako (pakosun)|]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Terashima Takuma]]

Not to be confused with [[Boggart (fate)|]], who is likewise a white lion humanoid from the [[Avalon le Fae (fate/grand order)|Britain Lostbelt]].

title: togami_byakuya_(danganronpa_2)
body:
A version of [[Togami Byakuya]] that appears in [i][[Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair]][/i]. In contrast to his appearance in the first game, he is [[obese]] and wears a white [[suit]].

[spoiler]In reality, his true identity is the [[Ultimate Imposter]], and he has no real name. His true appearance is revealed in Chapter 5 and in the anime [i][[Danganronpa 3 (anime)|]][/i], which simply narrows his eyes and gives him long [[black hair]] that has been [[hair slicked back|slicked back]]. He fills in for [[Mitarai Ryota]] in Hope's Peak while he is busy finishing his anime project.[/spoiler]

title: halo_framing
body:
The symbolic framing of an image/scene to make a character appear as if they have a halo without an actual halo being present. Often done through having a light source behind the head. Almost always the subject in question would be unaware that this is happening.

h4. Examples
* !post #8821712
* !post #7430091
* !post #7622077

H4. Things that don't count
* Actual halos
* Fake halos, mechanical halos, and painted halos
* Sun/moons or other light sources behind the subjects head but not framed as in a way to resemble a halo post #8952034

H4. Related
* [[Symbolism]]
* [[Sun behind head]] / [[moon behind head]]
* [[Backlighting]]
* [[Halo]]
** [[Traditional halo]]
** [[Halo behind head]]

title: mikihara_megumi
body: The brown-haired girl in [[Tokimeki Memorial 1]] who is shy and soft-spoken, and loves animals. Known also by series fans as Metto-chan, for her helmet-like [[blunt bangs]] and [[brown hair]].

title: enri_louvre
body:
The mute protagonist of [[Naraku]]. Shy and unable to approach people to make friends, she's dragged by the school bully [[Emma White]] to the purgatory building on a scare dare. She winds up trapped and becomes a demonic entity.

In [[Naraku 2]], she has mastered her new powers and has become more confident as a result. She's also more talkative- in a sense, as she is willing to communicate with [[Ebel Alfie|]] through facial expressions and emotions.

title: x_parasite
body:
A gelatinous and nigh-unkillable parasite introduced in [[Metroid Fusion]], native to the planet SR-388. Capable of asexual reproduction and perfect [[imitating|mimicry]] after infecting and killing a host, utilizing all memories prior to the host's demise. There is no known limit to how many forms can be consumed and utilized by a single X, resulting in enhanced abilities should it desire more strength.

They would have stood at the top of the universe's food chain, if not for their bio-engineered predator- the [[Metroid (creature)|]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25600816

h4. See also
* [[SA-X]]

title: chozo_statue
body:
[[Statue]]s that appear throughout the [[Metroid]] series. 

They are relics of an ancient [[Chozo]] civilization, left behind on various planets to immortalize them. In the statues' hands are often [[orb]]s that carry [[power-up]]s for [[Samus Aran|Samus]] to acquire.

Rarely they can come alive and attack those who trespass. These are known as [b]Torizo[/b] only in the English [[Super Metroid]] strategy guides.

title: ironmouse_outfit_art_contest
body:
The [i]Ironmouse Outfit Art Contest[/i] ran from January 13 to February 10, 2023, otherwise referred to by its hashtag name of the DressUpSayton Contest.

The contest was held so that viewers could make costume concepts for [[Ironmouse]], with the chosen winners being turned into proper models. Initially "slated":[https://twitter.com/ironmouse/status/1614034250092748807] to feature only five winners, a whopping 37 designs were chosen as winners upon the "reveal of the results":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eyVhKZG1cT0] on March 12th. Each winner won $1,000 each.

Use this tag for the designs created as part of the contest, whether it be art of the winners or otherwise.

h4. Winners

Winners will be listed in order of model creation (and if they haven't gotten a model yet, they'll be listed in the order they appeared in the results stream).

* !asset #25407049: Bloom Angel
* !asset #22858418: Winter Doll
* !asset #22858421: Sweet Nightmares
* !post #7815438: Decora
* !asset #22858451: Infernal Cult Princess
* !asset #24589345: Moonlight Demon
* !post #9191604: Cyber Mouse

h4. External links

* Ironmouse Model Index: "Contest winners":[https://www.ironmousemodelindex.com/contest-winners]

● Draw 2 cards, then discard 1 card.
● Discard 1 random card from your opponent's hand.
● Add 1 LIGHT monster from your GY to your hand.

title: shoot_that_guy_(meme)
body:
Shoot That Guy refers to a reaction image of the character [[cmd don wardaddy collier|Wardaddy]], portrayed by actor [[Brad Pitt]], from the 2014 movie [[Fury (movie)|]] pointing his finger at a German officer who hanged children and ordering a soldier to shoot him. The image achieved virality as a reaction on social media in 2023, being used similarly to the [[Let's Kill Him (meme)|]] reaction. It is also sometimes recaptioned using the phrasal template "X That Guy" in which the first word is changed to different actions.

h4. External links
* "Know Your Meme:  Shoot That Guy":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/shoot-that-guy

title: freudian_switch
body: A specific variation of [[freudian_slip|freudian slip]] where the person making the slip switches a line of internal thoughts with what they intended to say, usually resulting in them openly blurting out affection or irritation when they were trying to be more neutral.

title: freudian_slip
body:
When someone accidentally betrays subconscious thoughts (usually feelings of affection) in dialogue.

A more extensive gag will have someone thinking one line of thought while saying another, accidentally swapping the more private one for the other in the process (in both thought and speech balloons). Use the tag [[freudian_switch]] in that case.

title: the_protocols_of_the_elders_of_zion
body:
[b]The Protocols of the Elders of Zion[/b] is a fabricated text purporting to detail a Jewish plot for global domination. Largely plagiarized from several earlier sources, it was first published in Imperial Russia in 1903, translated into multiple languages, and disseminated internationally in the early part of the 20th century. It played a key part in popularizing belief in an international Jewish conspiracy.

h4.See also
* [[antisemitism]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: The Protocols of the Elders of Zion":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Protocols_of_the_Elders_of_Zion]

title: shaman
body:
[i]Shamanism[/i] ( /ˈʃɑːmən/ SHAH-mən or /ˈʃeɪmən/ SHAY-mən) is a practice that involves a practitioner reaching altered states of consciousness in order to encounter and interact with the spirit world. 

A [b]shaman[/b] is a person regarded as having access to, and influence in the world of benevolent and malevolent spirits, who typically enters into a trance state during a ritual, and practices divination and healing.

title: pope_francis
body:
Pope Francis (born Jorge Mario Bergoglio on 17 December 1936 - 21 April 2025) was the former 266th head of the Catholic Church, the bishop of Rome and sovereign of the Vatican City State. Was elected and became Pope on 13 March 2013 after his predecessor, Pope Benedict XVI, announced he would step down due to health issues. Notable for being the first Pope from the Americas and the Southern Hemisphere. Notable for his humility over pomp and grandeur, was sympathetic to the LGBT community and having friendly relationship with other religions and different Christian groups. Pope Francis died on 21 April 2025, Easter Sunday, after suffering from complications from pneumonia.

h4. See also

* [[Pope Francis Holding Things (Meme)]]
* [[Pope in White Puffer Jacket (Meme)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Pope Francis":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pope_Francis

title: mate
body:
The [b]Mate[/b], also called [b]Mate Argentino[/b] is a type of [[tea]] [[drink]] native to Latin America, particularly [[Argentina]] (where is the most popular), [[Uruguay]] and [[Paraguay]]. 

It is made by soaking dried leaves of the holly species, yerba mate ([i]Ilex paraguariensis[/i]), in hot water and is served with a metal straw in a container typically made from a calabash gourd (the Mate proper), but also in some areas made from a cattle horn ([b]Guampa[/b]).

title: dragon_ball_z_fukkatsu_no_f
body:
[b]Dragon Ball Z: Resurrection 'F'[/b] is the nineteenth film based on the [[Dragon Ball]] series and the fifteenth to carry the [[Dragon Ball Z]] branding, released theatrically on April 18, 2015. It is the first Japanese film to be screened in IMAX 3D and receive screenings at 4DX theaters.

Resurrection 'F' is the second film personally supervised by series creator [[Toriyama Akira]], following [[Dragon Ball Z Kami to Kami|Battle of Gods]] in 2013, having written its screenplay. The movie depicts the return of the villain [[Frieza]], as well as the God of Destruction [[Beerus]] and [[Whis]] from Battle of Gods.

Due to Resurrection F's incorporation into [[Dragon Ball Super]] later that year, this tag should only be used for art specifically about the movie.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Dragon Ball Z: Resurrection 'F'":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dragon_Ball_Z:_Resurrection_'F']

title: base_cabba_(meme)
body:
A [[Dragon Ball]] powerscaling [[meme]] which developed out of discourse trying to figure out power levels between [[Dragon Ball Super]] (the anime in specific) and [[Dragon Ball GT]]. [[Cabba]], one of the characters introduced in Super, was able to compete with [[Vegeta]] in his base form. Vegeta, just like [[Son Goku|Goku]], had learned to utilize the power of [[Super Saiyan God]] in his base form (commonly referred to in the community as 'Saiyan Beyond God', conceptually introduced in [[Dragon Ball Z Fukkatsu no F|Resurrection F]], kept for the Super anime adaptation, and avoided in the Super manga adaptation), which meant that, in terms of powerscaling, Cabba could compete with [[Beerus]] much in the same way Goku had in [[Dragon Ball Z Kami to Kami|Battle of Gods]] and its Super adaptations, arguably a greater feat than anything shown in GT.

As a result, this begged the hilarious question on whether or not Cabba in his base form was stronger than GT's [[Super Saiyan 4]] [[Gogeta]].

title: tommy_oliver
body:
A [[Power Rangers]] character, best known as the original [[Mighty Morphin Green Ranger|Mighty Morphin Green]] & [[Mighty Morphin White Ranger|White Ranger]] in [[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers]] (additionally serving as the Mighty Morphin-unique [[White Ninja Ranger]]). He would go on to be the longest-serving Power Ranger in the entire franchise, serving as [[Zeo Ranger V Red]] in [[Power Rangers Zeo]], the original [[Red Turbo Ranger]] in [[Power Rangers Turbo]], and the [[Black Dino Ranger]] in [[Power Rangers Dino Thunder]], as well as returning in one of these suits in [[Power Rangers Wild Force]], [[Power Rangers S.P.D.]], [[Power Rangers Megaforce|Power Rangers Super Megaforce]], and [[Power Rangers Ninja Steel|Power Rangers Super Ninja Steel]]. He was played by the late [[Jason David Frank]].

An alternate version of Tommy would appear in the [[Power Rangers (boom! Studios)|Boom! Studios]] comics, where he acts as [[Lord Drakkon]], serving as the primary antagonist in the Shattered Grid event (and its adaptation in [[Power Rangers: Battle For The Grid]]).

title: m78_fuwafuwa
body:
A line of [[Ultra Series]] [[character doll]]s that debuted in "September 2020":[https://twitter.com/ultraman_shop/status/1306918028043460614], featuring the various Ultras, as well as both allies and kaiju. Their full proper name are "M78 Ultraman Fuwafuwa o Suwari Nuigurumi", often shortened to just "M78 Fuwafuwa". They are based on the SD Ultraman style 'M78 Ultraman' designed by Nakata Kazuyuki, originally for [[Bandai]], starting from 1990 (with the designs featuring in merchandising, as well as in the 1999 short anime film Ultraman M78 Gekijou Love & Peace).

Commonly referred to as fuwa(fuwa)s, the release of the plushes inspired a whole wave of fanart based on the M78 Ultraman artstyle, sometimes emphasizing this inspiration by adding plush-like fuzzy lines to the characters. A parallel set of plushes exist, referred to as "M78 [[mochimochi mascot|Mochimochi]]" (or in full "M78 Ultraman Mochimochite Nori Nuigurumi"), which render the plushes as flying rather than sitting. They are included under this tag.

Use this tag for both the plushes, as well as art in the style of the plushes. Though the original M78 Ultraman style also remains popular (with a theme park using the style existing since 2008, for example), art inspired by the plushes generally renders the characters much rounder.

h4. External links

* "Collection M78 Ultraman: Tracing the History of M78 Ultraman (Japanese)":https://m78ultramania.hatenablog.com/entry/2023/04/16/175030
* "ULTRAMAN OFFICIAL SHOP: 特集 - ＃ふわふわといっしょ (2024/04)":https://www.m78-online.net/page/202404_fuwafuwa.html

title: shirai_kuroko
body:
A character from the light novel series [[Toaru Majutsu No Index]] and its spin-off manga series [[Toaru Kagaku No Railgun]].

Roommate of [[Misaka Mikoto]] and member of "[[Judgement armband (toaru)|Judgement]]", Academy City's student-based disciplinary committee. Kuroko is a Level 4 esper with the power to instantly teleport herself or items in her possession. Has an almost obsession-like crush on Mikoto, much to the latter's annoyance.

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied in [[twintails]] with [[red bow|red]] [[hair bow]]s.

She is sometimes seen holding [[throwing needles]].

title: salvatore_ganacci
body:
Salvatore Ganacci (real name: Emir Kobilić) is a Bosnian-Swedish [[DJ|disc jockey]] and record producer, specialized in EDM and dancehall music, among other genres. He is also known for his "meme-worthy live performances":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CA_0rWc-mZg] and music videos, featuring surrealist humor.

Salvatore was announced as a core collaborator on [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]], a 2025 fighting game by [[SNK]]. Not only was he instrumental as a music collaborator, both in-game and marketing, but he also features as a playable guest character, with a move list and presentation referencing his works.
other_names: サルバトーレ・ガナッチ

title: gentoo
body:
[b]Gentoo Linux[/b] (pronounced [i]JEN[/i]-too) is a [[Linux]] distribution built using the Portage package management system.

Gentoo lets the user build their system from the ground up by compiling programs from their source code. This approach allows tailoring software to work best with the [[computer]]'s hardware.

The operating system lets the user choose which features to include or exclude while installing software using a keyword tool called USE flags. 

It also uses a rolling release system, meaning it continuously updates software without the need for major upgrades. While it is considered by many to be challenging to install and set up than other Linux systems, it comes with extensive documentation and a helpful community for support.

h4. External links
* "Official website":[https://www.gentoo.org/]
* "Wikipedia: Gentoo Linux":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gentoo_linux]

title: yumeno_himiko
body:
Character from [i][[Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony]][/i].

The Ultimate Magician. She claims she is actually a mage, and her title as magician was only to help cover the existence of magic to the public. She is also very lazy, often calling things a pain and complaining that she doesn’t have enough MP for everyday tasks. Has an affinity for tight spaces. Often seen with [[Chabashira Tenko]].

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[red hair]] in a [[bob cut]], wears a [[black_hat|black]] [[witch hat]] and a [[hairclip]] adorned with a [[blue_gemstone|blue]] [[gem_hair_ornament|gem]]. Her [[school uniform]] consists of a [[black_jacket|black]] [[blazer]] with [[grey_sleeve_cuffs|grey accents]], a [[brown vest]], a [[red_skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], and [[pointy_boots|pointy]] [[brown boots]] with [[white_ribbon|white ribbons]] tied around her [[footwear_ribbon|ankles]]. On the pocket of her blazer is an [[insignia]] of her previous high school. She also carries around a [[staff]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #9156655

title: grimmchild
body: Companion NPC in [[Hollow Knight]], summoned whenever the titular charm is equipped. It resembles a miniature larval version of [[Grimm (hollow knight)|]] with [[tendril]]s growing from its back; as the [[Knight (hollow knight)|]] continues upgrading the charm it grows larger, deals more damage to enemies and more of its features turn from grey to red, with the tendrils turning into a set of [[bat wings|batlike wings]].
